Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a long time customer of Wells Fargo. I had a joint credit card and mortgage with them for almost 20 years. 

We paid off our mortgage earlier this year. Our joint credit card was tied to that mortgage so we made the decision to open individual credit cards. 

My husband received a credit limit of {$30000.00} at sign-up. 

I opened my new credit card shortly after he did and received a {$10000.00} credit limit. I have requested an increase twice and have been denied both times. My credit rating is higher than my husband 's, however, no one can tell me why I am declined, or why my limit is so low comparatively. 

I have spoken with Wells Fargo on 6 different occasions over the past 3 months. Yesterday, I was told by the credit underwriting department that the algorithms make these decisions and they aren't able to explain why nor are they able to bypass the decisions made. I have been told that my credit card account is too new to be considered for an increase. 

I am beyond frustrated. Wells Fargo has been dismissive of me, they close out my customer advocacy claim without even speaking to me. 

I feel as though I have no other options to look for support for this issue.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : XXXX XXXX & SmithDebnam Re : Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Violation As amended by Public Law XXXX, title X, XXXX Stat. XXXX ( XXXX ) and as a public service, the staff of the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) has provided us consumers the following text ( Excerpts ) of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act XXXX. XXXX. Unfair practices A debt collector XXXX not use unfair or unconscionable means to collect or attempt to collect any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : ( XXXX ) The collection of any amount ( including any interest, fee, charge, or expense incidental to the principal obligation ) unless such amount is expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
XXXX XXXX  and their attorneys violated my rights regarding an unlawful letter that was mailed to me by XXXX XXXX  Attorney containing content that was untrue and unlawful and a direct violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692e - False or misleading representations.

I have made several complaints regarding this and now I am hiring an attorney because it has devastated me and caused me mental anguish ever since I received a letter from the creditors ( XXXX XXXX  ) Attorneys ( SmithDebnam ) dated XX/XX/XXXX. I XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the amount the attorneys were asking which is not nor has it ever been consistent with what XXXX XXXX  has confirmed multiple times that I allegedly owe. 
SmithDebnam XXXX  me when I received a letter from attorneys at law and demanding payment of {$3400.00} which is over and more than the amount that XXXX XXXX has stated and confirmed multiple times through many disputes of the amount that I allegedly owe XXXX XXXX is in fact {$2300.00}, nothing more or nothing less. 
This is a direct violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692e - False or misleading representations, a federal violation. 
The actions of XXXX XXXX  and their attorneys Smith Debnam also violated XXXX XXXX laws with the same unlawful action, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX Deceptive representation No debt collector shall collect or attempt to collect a debt or obtain information concerning a consumer by any fraudulent, deceptive or misleading representation. Such representations include, but are not limited to, the following : ( XXXX ) Falsely representing the character, extent, or amount of a debt against a consumer or of its status in any legal proceeding ; falsely representing that the collector is in any way connected with any agency of the federal, XXXX or local government ; or falsely representing the creditor 's rights or intentions. 
I would like you to respond as to your position and what you propose as a remedy to these violations prior to me turning this entire nightmare you have put me through over to a FDCPA lawyer and filing a complaint with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  outlining the specific charges I feel you have violated. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Check was deposited in branch Monday XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX. I was guaranteed I would have XXXX $ on initial deposit and the vast majority two days later being XX/XX/XXXX that amount being XXXX $ of the total XXXX $ which was also guaranteed on the date XX/XX/XXXX in store. 

When I left the store I noticed the {$220.00} was actually scheduled to be deposited on the following business day after deposit being XX/XX/XXXX which prompted me to call customer service to ensure. 

Customer service told me this was the case and I would have to wait which I was okay with which was unfortunate but I understood she may have misspoke and the {$220.00} did deposit the next day. I specifically asked for a guarantee on the remaining funds being deposit on the business days that were agreed upon on the Wells Fargo branch which was guaranteed I had nothing to worry about and it would be deposited no issues. 
We got off the phone and I felt ensured I would have the money to pay all the financial obligations I had for XX/XX/XXXX including my daughters upcoming gifts and parties for their soon birthday party. 

I wake up on XXXX certain that the money would be in my account and I notice a notification on the app that my deposit had been delayed due to previous overdrafts prior to the initial check deposit money availability agreement set at the branch that they read and I assume had permission to guarantee knowing these prior instances Ive paid and been accountable for when I failed on my end. 

I was alerted the funds would be on hold until XXXX and then I would receive the morning of the day I was guaranteed the deposit of the funds ( XX/XX/XXXX ) via Wells Fargo App on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX  EST ( day of large deposit and two business days later ) stating it was now on hold until XX/XX/XXXX due to repeated overdrafts over the last six months. 

The following is direct quote Wells Fargo availability of funds policy pdf found on their website directly from the Availability of Funds Policy. 
Except as otherwise explained in this paragraph, if we are not going to make all funds from your deposit available on the business day of deposit or the first business day after the day of deposit, we will notify you at the time you make your deposit. We will also tell you when the funds will be available. If your deposit is not made directly to a Wells Fargo employee, or if we decide to take this action after you have left the premises, we will mail you the notice by the first business day after we receive your deposit. 

If you need the funds from a deposit right away, you should ask us when the funds will be available. 
In addition, funds you deposit by check may be delayed for a longer period under the following circumstances : We believe a check you deposit will not be paid You deposit checks totaling more than {$5500.00} on any one day You redeposit a check that has been returned unpaid You have overdrawn your account repeatedly in the last six months There is an emergency, such as failure of computer or communications equipment We will notify you if we delay your ability to withdraw funds for any of these reasons, and we will tell you when the funds will be available. The funds will generally be available no later than the seventh business day after the day of your deposit. 

Not only was I given specific guarantees from the actual teller in the branch about availability with dates of the money due to serious financial decisions relying on them following the laws and standards set forth for them, I was also given reassurance and guarantees from Wells Fargo customer service after leaving the branch and arriving home and calling to clarify issues. I was guaranteed I have nothing to worry about when specifically asking if I could get a guaranteed on the funds will be available. 

This leads me to calling Wells Fargo customer service today and then them telling me telling me theyll file an internal complaint based on my concerns and it could be two days. I just recently called and spoke with someone higher up who said due to the nature of the check the actual reason was I would have to wait for the check to expire and get a new check which has no timetable on time Ill never get back, monetary things I can lose, and family commitments I am currently fighting in other areas to find a way to make happen. All of this resulting in missing financial obligations that will permanently negatively impact me and reflect my character in the eyes of any financial based trust but also to my immediate family as I had obligations to the birthdays of my children which are less than a week away and Wells Fargo following the law and honoring their commitments or just actually trying to be proactive and fix the situation could have prevented. Now the accountability will fall onto me which Ill shoulder but I dont feel I was treated close to fairly and like it didnt seem to matter my circumstances of how much that amount of money was depended upon for my family. I dont want others to deal with the consequences of a company supposed to be trusted with your money and having that fall onto how people view their character and ability to follow up on their financial promises. 

Bottom line I feel many laws and regulations in the federal code of regulations have been blatantly and knowing violated by Wells Fargo only viewing the money being the issue and not the principle of the rules they claim to follow and what they claim to abide by in their Availability of Funds Policy. I feel it has been unrightfully pushed towards myself being at fault just as everyone around me may think but I firmly believe the treatment from Wells Fargo was unprofessional and unjust to the core principles and laws they follow. I will have to carry the consequences of them not following the bare minimum regulations and laws and regulations set for them and also regain the truth of the entities and individuals I made commitments to based upon trusting they would follow the laws and their Availability of Funds Policy standard to which they claim to follow. 

If theres anything Ive forgot I apologize and if some of this may seem upset its because of the impact not only at a financial level via serious financial commitments but commitments to my significant other and children and them questioning my character and trust in following through on my commitments. 

I honestly never expected to experience something like this but the amount may seem small but it was life saving for immediate financial situation my family is in. 

Thank you for reading this and taking time to try to help me come to terms with this.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I had filed the below complaint earlier today ... which was forwarded to Wells Fargo. A Wells Fargo representative called me this afternoon, and i mentioned i forgot to include the original letter i received from Wells Fargo Mortgage on the " Account Adjustment for overpaid interest during Covid-19 Deferral '' on my mortgage ending XXXX. The Wells Fargo employee suggested i do a new complaint and include the form and this will be forwarded to him. The employee is XXXX ( phone XXXX ). So in this submission i have listed the original complaint and uploaded the original letter from Wells Fargo Mortgage... stating that an interest rate change occurred during forbearance period resulting in overpaid interest during Covid 19 deferral. My complaint below is this overpayment of interest should also apply for my other mortgage loan ( LXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) which was under Covid 19 Deferral for the same period..only difference i paid off this loan in XX/XX/2020. Here is the previous note i sent to CFPB : " I had two Mortgages with Wells Fargo Bank. The first Mortgage ( XXXX # : XXXX ) with a principal balance of {$720000.00} was paid off on XX/XX/2020. The 2nd Mortgage ( Loan # : XXXX ) with a balance of ~ {$280000.00} is still active. During the Covid period in 2020, i took Covid-19 Deferral for both mortgages for the exact same period ( due to Covid Deferral my mortgage payments were deferred ). In 2020 i received a letter from Wells Fargo saying on my mortgage that is still active ( Loan # : XXXX ) Wells Fargo Overcharged me for Deferred Interest ( something to do with interest rate change occurrence ) and gave me a refund/interest rate adjustment of {$3900.00} and a check for {$370.00} for a total of {$4300.00}. I then contacted Wells Fargo and said this interest rate change occurrence also applied to the other mortgage which i paid off in ( Loan # XXXX ). This loan had a principal balance of {$720000.00} and then Wells Fargo made me pay {$740000.00} or + {$15000.00} due to interest and " other charges ''. I believe this includes Deferred interest due to Covid 19, and this interest calculation is incorrect ( made the same mistake as my current loan ). I wrote to Wells Fargo 3 times on this, and they have not responded. Since the mortgage is paid off they do not want to open a can of worms because if this mistake applies to all loans with Covid 19 Deferral that were paid off Wells Fargo will have a big liability on their hands. I would greatly appreciate your assistance in looking into the interest calculation for both loans ... and check if the mistake made on the loan where they gave me a refund applies to the larger loan. The dollars are very material for me. Thank you ''

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising about the credit card
Consumer complaint narrative: Chase advertises their XXXX XXXX credit card as offering " trip cancellation and trip interruption insurance '' which is not only misleading but false. I have been a cardholder for many years and use the card for all my travel, believing this " benefit '' actually existed. On a recent trip overseas my passport was stolen and the result was a delay in my scheduled travel plans. When I filed a claim with Chase Benefits I received an email stating that the claim was denied because ( 1 ) the claim expenses were ineligible since they were not for aCommon Carrier Fare '' and ( 2 ) a change in plans caused the trip cancellation. Both reasons were ridiculous since the claim involved XXXX XXXX and there was no " change in plans '' there was a stolen passport. I contacted them again and explained this. They sent another email denying the claim again but this time providing yet a DIFFERENT reason : the claim was denied because the loss was " not covered '' since it was not ( 1 ) a XXXX attack ( 2 ) severe weather or ( XXXX ) airline operational difficulty. Again, I appealed based on the fact that the Benefits Guide provided with the card specifically states that if losses result in cancellation or interruption of a trip the cardholder is reimbursed. It specifically states " The benefit covers a broad array of " what ifs that can impact travel plans ''. I received my THIRD yet different reason for denial : " the benefit does not apply to any loss caused by ... failure of the covered person to obtain necessary passports ''. Ridiculous. I absolutely obtained my necessary passport ( and visas ) yet they were stolen! They did acknowledge that " the Guide to Benefits confirms you may be reimbursed for forfeited, non-refundable prepaid land, air or sea transportation arrangements missed '' but fail to inform the cardholder that they decide when and if at their sole discretion.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative: Today, Monday XX/XX/XXXX I received a voice message stating that there was a complaint being made against me and I needed to call back immediately because legal action was eminent. I was shocked and dismayed, and they informed me to call Wells Fargo about it and to talk to the Chargeoff Recovery Dept. I did just that, and had recorded conversations about this. No one at Wells Fargo could locate this info, and said that maybe it was linked to a loan. After talking with the loan department, then XXXX XXXX, no one could find any kind of information about this. They seemed suspicious, and I was encouraged to call back XXXX XXXX and require them to give me a contact number or info for Wells Fargo. The woman on the line handed over the phone to her manager, who then said that this account no longer belonged to Wells Fargo and that I had to handle this with them. The man became very mean, lots of yelling and belittling. Then he asked how much I was willing to settle the {$2200.00} debt for, and I said I preferred to speak with a Wells Fargo Bank representative. This made him even more angry, and he threated legal action and attorney fees, then hung up on me. I was so terrified I called back Wells Fargo Bank and let them know what happened. The woman on the line checked again to see if she could find any information about this linked to me, and she could not. She consulted her manager, who then told her that Wells Fargo would never pursue legal action with me over this, nor go through a third party. She said this was probably a scam. So now I am very disturbed to know that they have my sensitive information, and I don't know what to do.

Over the past few months, I have received multiple unsolicited calls from a number associated with these organizations. On each occasion, the callers have been reticent about their identities and their company 's purpose. This includes not properly identifying themselves, abruptly ending the call when asked for identification, and insisting on personal confirmation before disclosing any information. 

Specifically, the dates and times of the calls are as follows : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX All but the last were unanswered as I was unable to while working. After multiple attempts to ask for his identity and company representation, he abruptly hung up. This call lasted a mere XXXX seconds. 

Immediately following this, I called back, hoping to gain clarity about the nature of these continuous calls. However, the representative I reached, again, refused to identify himself or the company he represented, and immediately asked if I was " <my name> '' This call ended after XXXX seconds, with little progress made. 

I called back one more time and I was able to speak with a female representative who informed me that they were calling from " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' on behalf of their client, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I was told that I owed a debt significantly higher than what has ever been reported on my credit report. The representative claimed that such increases were normal, and cited an example of a consumer who had a {$200.00} XXXX card but had to pay {$700.00}. I was shocked at this admission. Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2022, I made an ACH transfer of {$10000.00} from my checking account at Wells Fargo to a new checking account at XXXX XXXX. I got a transaction number from the transfer and then an email from XXXX that my money was successfully deposited into my XXXX Account. I tried to get into my new XXXX account on two occasions after that, but there were technical difficulties getting into my new account. When I finally got into the new XXXX account, the balance of the checking account was XXXX ( {$0.00} ). I immediately called the XXXX number and was told there was a " flag '' on my account and that I would need to go into the branch at XXXX to get an explanation. I went into the branch at XXXX and they told me that the flag was due to a suspicion for fraud, since I deposited a " large amount '' of {$10000.00} into a new account. I asked where my money was, since it was not in the new account. At that time, the XXXX branch thought the money was sent back to Wells Fargo. Since then, I have been on a search for my {$10000.00}. Wells Fargo tells me that XXXX has the money and XXXX tells me that Wells Fargo has the money. I have put in at least 20 claims on this issue at both banks and I have still gotten nowhere in terms of finding my money. All of the telephone calls are recorded at Wells Fargo, so if they need to be accessed, that should not be an issue. My issue with the lost {$10000.00} has been escalated to different people and managers at both banks and still there is no resolution. I have asked the banks to talk to eachother to try to resolve my issue and noone from XXXX will speak with bankers or managers at Wells Fargo and vice versa. I have had bank " investigators '' look for the money and still XXXX blaims Wells Fargo and Wells Fargo blaims XXXX. Wells Fargo has had me contact my local police about a " financial crime '' against XXXX. I called my local police and they told me that since I have tracking numbers and emails, that this is an issue for the banks to solve, not the local police. Now, Wells Fargo tells me that XXXX XXXX XXXX probably has my money. I will supply this explaination to you in the file uploading area. I feel like these banks have failed me as a consumer. Wells Fargo recently told me to call XXXX XXXX XXXX about the lost funds. I was simply told to call the " executive branch ''. There is no number to call at XXXX XXXX XXXX  for an executive branch. When you call XXXX XXXX XXXX if you want to speak with someone, you have to have an account. I do not have an account there. I called my local XXXX XXXX XXXX and they told me they do not have a number or email address for XXXX XXXX XXXX executive offices. Why am I trying to contact XXXX XXXX XXXX  when my transaction was between Wells Fargo and XXXX?? I am told that XXXX XXXX XXXX helps with the transactions between Wells Fargo and other banks. I have more recently been told by Wells Fargo that XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX helps with the transactions between XXXX and other banks. I get different stories every time I contact these banks. In case this isn't confusing enough, XXXX tells me that a company called XXXX helps them with their transactions. I have called XXXX to see if they could have the {$10000.00}, but they tell me they need to know which of their " divisions '' is used by XXXX so they can help me. I have contacted the NC Commissioner of Banks about XXXX. The response from XXXX was very generic, stating that I should call the XXXX number at Wells Fargo to help me. That is laughable, since I have called Wells Fargo more times than I can count. I will attach that letter to this compaint. Again, my ACH transaction was from Wells Fargo to a new account at XXXX. It never showed up in my XXXX XXXX  account and I have not seen the money since XX/XX/. Thank you for your help in this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX and Lockhart & Morrison, as well as the three major credit reporting agencies : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 

Background Information I have no contractual agreements with either XXXX XXXX XXXX or Lockhart & Morrison ; however, I have received multiple calls and letters from both companies attempting to collect alleged debts. Additionally, both companies have reported these accounts to the credit reporting agencies, which has negatively impacted my credit score. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) The actions of XXXX XXXX XXXX and Lockhart & Morrison, along with the failure of XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX to adequately investigate and correct these inaccuracies, constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681, which governs consumer reporting. This statute provides consumers with protections against inaccuracies and unauthorized reporting on their credit reports. 

Request for Action I am requesting the following actions be taken : 1. Investigation and Removal : I ask that the CFPB investigate the practices of XXXX XXXX XXXX and Lockhart & Morrison regarding the collection of debts for which I have no contractual obligation. I request the immediate removal of these accounts from my credit reports with XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 
2. Removal of Inaccurate Information : I urge the credit reporting agencies to correct their records and remove any negative reporting associated with these accounts, as they are based on false claims. 
3. Enforcement of My Rights : I seek enforcement of my rights under the FCRA, ensuring that these companies cease their unlawful collection practices and that the credit reporting agencies comply with their obligation to report accurate information. 



Conclusion I appreciate your attention to this serious matter and look forward to your prompt response. Please inform me of any updates regarding the investigation and actions taken in response to my complaint. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a complaint against Caine & Weiner regarding their violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). The collection agency in question has added a debt to my credit history without any agreement or written authorization from me. 


Despite my request that they return the alleged debt to the original creditor, the collection agency has continued to pursue collection activities against me, which I believe is a violation of my rights under the FDCPA. I have also requested debt validation, as is my right under the FDCPA, but the agency has not provided me with any proof that I owe this debt. 
I believe that this collection agency has violated several provisions of the FDCPA, including but not limited to : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 2 ) ( A ) - falsely representing the character, amount, or legal status of the debt 2. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 5 ) - threatening to take any action that can not legally be taken or that is not intended to be taken 3. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 10 ) - using false representations or deceptive means to collect or attempt to collect any debt 4. 15 U.S.C. 1692f ( 1 ) - using unfair or unconscionable means to collect or attempt to collect any debt I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this collection agency for their violations of the FDCPA and take appropriate action to ensure that they cease all collection activities related to this debt and that they correct any negative reporting on my credit history.

Consumer complaint narrative: I signed up for a Delta SkyMiles American Express Gold credit card in early XX/XX/2023. There was a promotional offer for XXXX Bonus Delta SkyMiles for signing up. Fortunately I emailed myself a screenshot of the offer because when the bonus came through it was only XXXX miles. I just called American Express and they said that I only signed up for the XXXX mile offer and that I can't switch now. That is obviously not what happened. Why would I take a screenshot of an XXXX mile offer and then go sign up for a smaller offer? I wonder how many people sign up for the XXXX mile offer and Amex accidentally places them in the XXXX mile offer. These " mistakes '' always happen in the big company 's favor, so they can't be random. I cancelled the card, but I would still like my missing miles. And more than anything, I would like all of these big companies that do this to consumers to stop. The reason I took a screenshot is because this kind of thing happens all the time. Even if they are required to give me the missing miles they will come out ahead because they will only be giving me what they should have given me in the first place, but most people won't even follow up on it so they come out ahead on all of those people. I don't understand why there isn't more severe penalties for consumer fraud, especially from big companies who have the resources to treat people fairly. The penalty doesn't have to go to me, but it could go to funding the organizations that are supposed to be overseeing this kind of thing so that they are better equipped to manage it.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute an unauthorized inquiry listed on my XXXX credit report, which I believe is inaccurately affecting my credit score and profile. According to my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically referencing 15 USC 1681b, I am entitled to dispute inaccurate information reported in my credit file. 
Inquiry Details : - Creditor/Institution : TD AUTO FIN - Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/2023 - Reported By : XXXX I have no recollection nor record of authorizing this inquiry, and as such, I consider it to be inaccurate. I hereby request a thorough investigation into this matter. According to the FCRA, all information reported on my credit report must be accurate, complete, and verified. If this inquiry can not be verified as accurately authorized by me, it must be removed from my credit report. 
Request for Documentation : Furthermore, I demand that all documents, contracts, or agreements that bear my original signature and purport to authorize the aforementioned inquiry be provided to me. If no such documentation can be furnished within 15 days of receipt of this letter, then in accordance with the FCRA, this inquiry should be promptly removed from my credit report.
Company public response: None

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I paid {$15000.00} to XXXX XXXX for a program that included housing for XXXX months. On XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed I was being kicked out of this housing ( that I had prepaid for ) on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Soon after, after not receiving any information from XXXX about new housing or a passable explanation for why I was being kicked out of housing I had a contract for, I filed a dispute with Chase. I provided evidence that I was not provided with the services I paid for, and asked them to let me know if they needed anything else from me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a phone call from Chase and an agent told me that I could expect the disputed amount ( more than {$10000.00} ) to be a permanent credit in my account within the next week or two, and that they would let me know if they needed anything else from me or whenever they had another update. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, when I logged into my account, I noticed I had been rebilled for the disputed amount ( with no communication from Chase ). I appealed the dispute findings, and spent more than 10-15 hours on hold and on the phone with Chase over the next couple of months, only to eventually learn that my appeal was never considered, because it was past the deadline to appeal the decision. However, the dispute was decided after this deadline, and I never was told this in all of the time I spent on the phone with them, or communicated in any other way. 

I got connected to their executive team, and basically have lived through this process again over the past couple of months, with terrible communication, failed promises to call me back ( even after a message sent through a colleague was acknowledged that Id cleared my schedule for the full day ), and it is just absolutely unacceptable how they have handled my problem and their disregard for me receiving more than {$10000.00} in services I did not receive. This is XXXX worse than any other customer experience I have had, and now Ive been charged another annual fee because theyve taken so long to not get me help with my situation.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing a formal complaint against Visa for their gross mishandling of a dispute related to charges from XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite clear evidence of fabricated documentation and serious misrepresentations by the merchant, Visa overturned a previously resolved dispute in my favor, resulting in significant financial harm and emotional distress. 

Summary of the Complaint : Acceptance of Fabricated Documentation : Visa accepted documentation from the merchant that was clearly erroneous and unrelated to my transaction. The documents included another individuals name and address, incorrect service dates, and a forged signature. This should have been identified as fabricated during Visas review process, yet it was inexplicably accepted as valid. 
Misrepresentation by the Merchant : The merchant, XXXX XXXX XXXX, misrepresented themselves as a moving company when they were actually operating as a broker. This crucial information was never disclosed to me, leading to a significant misunderstanding of the services I was engaging in. Visas acceptance of their documentation allowed this misrepresentation to go unaddressed.

Unjustified and Inflated Charges : I was provided with an initial estimate by the merchant, which was later doubled without any justification. Despite providing evidence of this price gouging, Visa still sided with the merchant, demonstrating a lack of thorough investigation and disregard for fair consumer treatment. 
Overcharging for Supplies : I was overcharged for moving supplies that were either not used or incorrectly categorized, leading to inflated costs. Visas review process did not properly address this, further exacerbating the financial harm I suffered.

Failure to Provide Agreed Services and Missing Items : The merchant failed to provide the agreed services, including unpacking at the destination, and several valuable items were missing upon delivery. Despite providing detailed evidence of these failures, Visa ignored these issues, leading to an unjust decision against me.

Impact on Me : Visas acceptance of fabricated documentation and their failure to properly investigate this dispute have caused me significant financial loss and emotional distress. This experience has severely undermined my trust in Visas ability to protect consumers from fraudulent practices. 
Requested Resolution : I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly. I seek a re-evaluation of my dispute, expecting that Visa will correct

its mistake and refund the disputed amount. I also request that the CFPB ensure Visa implements more rigorous review processes to prevent such failures in the future.

I am prepared to provide any additional information or documentation the CFPB may require to support this complaint. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative: I am a customer of Wells Fargo, and I made a certified Cashier 's check in the amount of {$5000.00} payable to XXXX XXXX. On the week prior to XXXX, I mailed the check to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NJ to pay my credit card balance, but XXXX XXXX never received the payment. On XX/XX/, I went to my local Wells Fargo XXXX in XXXX, NC to stop the payment on the check thinking that the check was lost in the mail. XXXX " XXXX XXXX '' was assisting me with the process. XXXX saw that the check was negotiated to someone named " XXXX XXXX '' I showed him a copy of the original check that it was payable to " XXXX XXXX '' We decided to open a fraud investigation. Wells Fargo fraud handling team 's opened a case ( XXXX ) Wells Fargo rep and banker told me that the case will be resolved within 30 business days, and I will receive my funds within 10 business days. I wanted to report the fraud to law enforcement. On XX/XX/, I called the fraud claims center to collect information about where the check was negotiated in order to notify the proper law enforcement agency. The rep I spoke with did not have any information. However, they mentioned that the investigator handling my case should. I requested to speak with the investigator and was told that the investigator will call me at my phone number. On XX/XX/, I called back for updates on the claim as I had not received any phone call. The rep said that the investigator attempted to contact me with no success. I mentioned that I never received any phone call or voicemail. The rep put in another request for the investigator to call me back. the 10 days mark passed by, and I did not receive my funds back, nor did I get any updates or phone call. On XX/XX/, I called the claims center again and insisted on speaking with the investigator. The rep said that I should fill out the affidavit and send it to Wells Fargo. I mentioned that I never received any paperwork and that I still had not received any phone call from the investigator. The rep said that the investigator attempted to contact me a few times even though there was never any voicemail or messages received. I went to my local branch and expressed my frustration. The banker " XXXX XXXX '' helped me get the affidavit form by email. I also filed a complaint with Wells Fargo Executive team about how my case was handled with complete negligence and lack of transparency. Wells Fargo Executive team opened a case XXXX. After investigating the fraud case, I finally got the response that the check was negotiated at a XXXX XXXX XXXX, and I had to wait up to 120 days for a response from that bank. I insisted that I wanted to know where the altered check was negotiated, so I could notify law enforcement in that jurisdiction. Consumers Fraud is a deliberate misrepresentation on which a banking business intends for natural person consumers to rely. Consumer fraud is a form of misrepresentation committed by beneficiary seller banks or financial institutions against a buyer or a group of buyers that are natural person investment companies to whom a banking business deliberately misrepresented any Social Security Number card thing with the intent that a natural ( fool ) person consumer will rely on the misrepresentation that a SSN is used for identity verification purposes, resulting in harm or loss to par value, at least to some natural person consumer who believes so. Consumer fraud is barred by statute and, unlike common-law fraud of agency undisclosed principal doctrine, in most jurisdictions is complete at the time of a deliberate misrepresentation of a SSN as identity or the commission of a deceitful and fraudulent practice. An action against a banking corporation or financial institution for consumer fraud does not require PROOF of reliance on the misrepresentation by or deception of a natural person consumer. Consumer fraud committed by a beneficiary seller Bank of collateral securities, such as bills or notes belonging to a natural person consumer, involved with interstate commerce is regulated by the Federal Trade Commission , Bureau of Consumer Protection that is authorized to stop fraudulent practices against SSN card holders.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2023, I received an email notifying me that a XXXX account had been created using my email address, and seconds later I got a second email confirming my purchase for tickets using that XXXX account in the total amount of {$1800.00}. I knew I had not created this account and it had to be fraud, so in order to prevent the fraudulent parties from getting what they wanted, I went to XXXX  to attempt to reset the password to this fraudulent account, in order for me to get access to an account I had not set up and therefore didn't have the password to, so I could change the password and block the fraudulent parties 's access to that account. I set up a new password so I could then access the account. I first tried looking for a way in XXXX to cancel and return the tickets untouched, but there was no such option, so I immediately closed the XXXX account unused and called my credit card company, Chase, to report the fraud. In the months following, we had several calls with XXXX where they continued to state they were investigating my claim with statements that they would follow up with me within 24 to 48 hours with updates, which they never did. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from Chase that their findings were the charge was valid, so I contacted Chase and XXXX in tandem again to dispute the charge. On a subsequent call XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX admitted that the account was created fraudulently while Chase was on the line, but they never sent a confirmation email containing that statement on their letterhead as Chase required, nor did they issue a refund. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up again with Chase who informed me that I had to reach out to XXXX directly, which I did immediately. XXXX claimed that they'd won the chargeback claim that Chase issued, that the bank ( i.e. Chase ) agreed with XXXX that this transaction was not fraudulent, and that no refund would be issued. According to XXXX, part of their " Riskified '' process to prevent fraud was to send a text message to the account holder, and once that message was responded to with an approval, that validated the account. I stated to XXXX  that I received no such text message, and when asked what phone number XXXX used to send this supposed message, they said they had no record of the phone number used to send this text message. I did NOT create this fraudulent account. I did NOT purchase these tickets from XXXX. I do NOT agree with the decision rendered by XXXX or Chase, and I am filing a police report for this fraudulent charge in combination with this complaint. I intend to take legal action absent a timely refund for this fraudulent charge. I can provide records of the above actions upon request.

Your service to folks like myself is greatly appreciated. We need more agencies like this to fight these greedy monsters and we need permanent laws to keep them from doing it again! Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello my name is XXXX XXXX I am the Biological Heir of XXXX XXXX my XXXX died with out will I was contacted by chase mortgage about his death and his estate I contacted them with his Death certificate and my birth certificate to show that he was my biological father and chase mortgage decided to sell property after I sent them the information about his death i updated and instead of following state and federal statue codes they sold or pre foreclosed on property by using a third party debt collector who filed for a auction for property then the they talked to XXXX child about XXXX XXXX account Federal Act I the right to sell house His wife had will for her she was not co signer on XXXX XXXX Mortgage so property inherited by the next of kin when I called the bank would only talk to step child and sent pay off quote to step child The federal act they broke was GarnSt Germain Act they never let me take over payments Key Provisions of the Act Right to privacy act The Garn St. Germain Act addressed due-on-sale clauses in mortgage contracts. These clauses allowed lenders to demand full repayment when a property changed hands. The Act recognized these clauses as enforceable but introduced critical exceptions for specific situations. 

One major exception involved property inheritance. When a family member inherits a property, they can continue the deceaseds mortgage payments without refinancing. This exception is vital for heirs who might not qualify for a new loan. 
Another exception concerns joint tenants. It allows property owners to add certain family members, like a spouse or child, to the property title without triggering the mortgages full repayment. 
The Act also supports estate planning. It allows property transfers into a certain type of trust without demanding loan repayment. This is crucial for managing assets and avoiding probate. Many individuals plan to avoid the complicated and public probate process through an inter vivos trust. Also called a revocable living trust, this legal tool allows for a more accessible estate administration process for your loved ones. 
In North Carolina, these provisions streamline real estate transactions involving inherited properties. They provide clarity and financial relief for families during the transfer of ownership. 

Understanding these key provisions helps heirs and property owners plan effectively. It ensures smooth transitions in property ownership and mortgage responsibilities. You can read more about what the act did for the average American at XXXX or talk with an experienced estate planning attorney.
Company public response: None

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Paid rent on XX/XX/XXXX via XXXX XXXX online as I have done without issue before. Rent check showed as delivered and deposited within a few days. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a text from my landlord that he had not received rent check. After some discussion, we determined that it must have been stolen from his mailbox or during transit. The proof of payment provided by Chase clearly shows the check was endorsed by someone other than my landlord, they signed it with a completely different person 's name.

I called Chase to let them know a check had been stolen and deposited by someone who was not the payee. After hours of being transferred between different departments, they opened a claim, Claim # XXXX, and issued a temporary credit for the amount of the check, {$2600.00}. 

A few days later, they emailed a PDF with an affidavit for me and my landlord to fill out to describe the issue and attest to what happened. We both filled it out, and on XX/XX/XXXX, he faxed it to the fax number listed on the claim form, which belongs to the Chase claims department. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an electronic letter from Chase stating that my claim had been closed, that they had determined the check was processed normally, and that they would be debiting the previously refunded amount from my account. I called to let them know this was in error, and they said that because they had not received the affidavit, they were closing the claim. I let them know when and where the claim was faxed to, but they claim to have never received it.

They are now opening a new claim, but with no refund given for the stolen check, and are saying that the investigation process will take 90 days, upon which I may be given a refund if the claim was determined to be valid. I have to go through the affidavit process all over again, and take further steps to ensure that they actually process the form once it's been faxed and mailed once again.

This is a nightmare, and I am out {$2600.00} because someone stole the check I sent via Chase XXXX and deposited the check, with an endorsement that is clearly not the signature of the payee. On the CFPB website it states that banks are responsible for ensuring the check endorsement matches the identity of the payee. That did not happen here.
Company public response: None

I have a American Express Delta Skymile Credit card for few years. I received an offer on XX/XX/XXXX to upgrade my credit card and receive XXXX skymiles if certain criteria were met. They are enclosed in the PDF attached. Once, I met those criteria and called them for the first time in XX/XX/XXXX, they said skymiles were issued and taken back immidiately against my past negative skymiles balance. I kept asking in several subsequent calls for months to give me promissed skymiles and if not why would they not show negative skymile in my account. I was never given the skymiles they promissed in the deceptive promotion and no one ever gave me an answer and simply hid behind the line 'This is company Policy '. If company policy is to hide information from client so they can steal from their client in future, then this is a deceptive practice and a regulatory action is warranted on the company. Furthermore, if the company already knew that I have a negative skymiles balance in my account, why did they choose to send me an offer when they certainly knew that they will deduct these miles from the clients account. They chose not to disclose about my negative balance in this offer email. This is another deceptive pratice by the company.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I wrote a check for XXXX dollars to a Wells Fargo customer for a completed work project. The check was paid by my bank the next day, XX/XX/XXXX, Monday. Wells Fargo put a hold on the check stating that my signature was incorrect and suggesting to their customer that I cancel the check and reissue it. 

The hold was for XXXX  days ( until XX/XX/XXXX ). For the next ten days, the reps at Wells continued to tell their customer that my signature was wrong and that was the reason for the hold. Each time their customer came back to me asking me to re-write the check, I had to tell him that the check was paid and Wells had my money. 

This resulted in confusion as the Wells customer wanted to believe what his bank was telling him. When he showed the reps at Wells a copy of the canceled check, they took a belligerent tone with him. 

I've complained to the XXXX, FDIC, and NC DOJ. The latter two agencies referred my complaint to the Comptroller in XXXX. All agencies with the exception of the XXXX claimed confidentially issues barred them from addressing my complaint. 

My concern is that non-English speakers ( and possibly others ) are being targeted with excessive check-holding practices, citing false reasons. My understanding is that every bank has a right to hold checks for any number of reasons. My problem is that Wells used me to lie to its customer. If they are doing this to others it is causing a headache for many. The payoff is that they earn pennies to the dollar in interest on every cashed and held check. 

The reps at Wells Fargo will cite confidentiality reasons when they view my complaint. And that is understood. But so far, I'm led to believe the bank will continue this bad practice unless they are held accountable.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I fell ill in late XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX and was out of work with no pay for XXXX weeks. I contacted XXXX Credit Card company late XXXX for financial assistance as I could not get my feet back on the ground once returning to work. I originally was told I qualified for credit protection, that I have been paying for the entire time I had this card. I did exactly what they told me to do supplied with a note from my doctor. I did not hear back for over 30 days ( the time told it may take to process ). When I reached back out I was told by a supervisor I was declined from the program as it turns out I did not meet the requirements for credit protection like they originally thought. Because I was not out of work for XXXX days or more, it was only XXXX days, they declined the protection. Keeping in mind I only signed up for credit protection as my chronic documented medical illness was supposed to be covered by their protection provided I have doctors notes of being under a doctor 's care for a significant amount of time ( as it is in all my other credit cards too, suffering from illness for XXXX years now so I am always sure to check this ). The supervisor was extremely rude saying if I was sick for longer I would qualify but I was about XXXX week short of that. He said I could do the re-age program and sent me over to sign up for that. Lovely woman got me all set up, she told me if I sign up to split my delinquent amount up into XXXX autopay monthly payments my account would be current so long as I made all XXXX payments. I have made XXXX of the XXXX ( XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ) and got a notice of my account still being past due ( today XX/XX/XXXX ). I contacted the company to which I was told the re-age program does NOT bring accounts current until AFTER the payments are made, thus my credit will be hit when the XXXX days ( month XXXX ) of the program ends. I would never have signed up for this program if it was going to affect my credit, I would have worked to try to find other arrangements to make my account current. Now, we are months into trying to get assistance to no avail all while my credit is taking massive hits. The only thing I was told repeatedly today when asking how this re-age program will affect my credit and what options I have is a repeated response " we report fairly and accurately, I recommend calling in for further assistance. Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of 2019 I opened a checking and savings account at Wells Fargo Bank with an opening deposit of a little over {$5000.00}. I sat with my banker and went over all recent transactions that had posted to my account and indicated which ones were not made by me. That information was then submitted to the Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX. Approximately XXXX week later, I received a phone call from the Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX. The agent was quite rude and condescending and informed me that Wells Fargo would not refund the stolen money to me because they believed that it was myself or someone who knew me that had made the transactions. I informed them that I had not made those transactions, nor had I authorized anyone to have access to my account. I even spoke with the agent 's supervisor and was again told that my stolen funds would not be returned. When I asked how they had reached the decision they made, they informed me that XXXX or more of the transactions listed as fraudulent had been made using the chip-enabled debit card assigned to my account. I know this information to be false because I am a XXXX XXXX and was working in Maryland at the time. I opened the account at a branch in Maryland and was issued a temporary debit card ( which did not have a chip in it ). The chip-enabled debit card was mailed to my home in North Carolina XXXX XXXX was still in the sealed envelope it had arrived in. When i confronted the agent and supervisor with this information, they abruptly ended the call. They also did not close the compromised accounts immediately. By leaving the accounts opened, it also compromised my XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX account that was linked to the Wells Fargo account. I have made multiple attempts to resolve this issue since that time but have been unable to get anyone from Wells Fargo to help recover my money. As a result of their actions my XXXX  XXXX XXXX accounts were closed and listed as " checking account XXXX ''. Wells Fargo finally closed my checking account with them after it became overdrawn. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: A charge-off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed in my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

I was stranded in a whole other state because they wouldn't release MY MONEY for the LONGEST hold I've ever heard of!!!! Then they charged me to cash it when I had an account!!!!! My ( previous ) normal due date the ( XXXX ) was now the ( XXXX ), which made it show I was late. Auto pay will not pick up on this change, Thus showing I was late far later than I would have been with my last company ( XXXXXXXX XXXX  ). Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Furnisher of information : Wells Fargo Account XXXX XXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 it states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' Wells Fargo is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' Wells Fargo the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not havemy written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, Wells Fargo whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 
15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' Wells Fargo NEVER informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account listed above is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. 
Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been banking with Chase Bank for the past XXXX months and really enjoyed the experience and all they have to offer. Two days ago they made the decision to close my bank accounts and freeze my funds. 

On XX/XX/year> I received a requested for a wire reversal to a client who had recently made multiple purchases from my company. I responded to the bank with a detailed letter explaining why I would deny the reversal of funds. Essentially stating the client paid for items and received all items in full. The bank said they would investigate the matter and get back to me. 

In my letter I detailed how the client had made a few purchases of products and paid through wire transfer. After the funds were received by my company the client came into our business and received the items he ordered in full. When I received the request for wire reversal I called my client to see why the request was placed. He told me that his bank issued the request not him. As well as explaining to me that after he purchased the items from my business he then handed the products over the another individual for safekeeping. It turns out the other individual had no intention of storing the items for him and stole the items to keep for himself. He was scammed by an individual not associated with my company. Obviously we can not be held liable for a client poor decision making after our business has been completed. 

On XX/XX/year> I received a text message saying I needed to provide account information to keep my accounts active. When I called I was notified that my accounts were being closed and there was nothing to be done about it. When I asked about access to my funds I was told there is no timeline for them to send me a certified check in the mail. I have received XXXX communication from the bank in this matter since I called to find out they have decided to close the accounts. 

This experience has been financially and emotionally draining. We can not operate without our funds. We have continued to lose business each day we do not have access to them. We need this issue escalated and resolved immediately. We have done nothing wrong in this entire situation and we are being punished for it. Not only losing access to our bank accounts, but now losing business everyday our funds are frozen.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to file a formal complaint against Wells Fargo regarding their inadequate handling of a credit card dispute involving an unjustified charge of {$72.00}. Despite providing ample evidence that the charge was fraudulent, Wells Fargo failed to conduct a thorough investigation and wrongfully upheld the charge, resulting in significant financial and emotional distress. 

*Background : On XX/XX/year>, I utilized XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX to send a XXXX envelope abroad. On XX/XX/year>, I noticed an unexpected charge of {$72.00} on my credit card statement. I immediately disputed the charge with Wells Fargo and provided detailed documentation supporting my claim that the charge was unjustified.

*Issues with Wells Fargo 's Investigation : 1. Acceptance of Fraudulent Documentation : Wells Fargo accepted documentation from XXXX XXXX that was clearly fraudulent. The receipt provided by XXXX XXXX in response to my dispute contained placeholders such as changeme in the address line, and both the company and tax numbers were listed as " XXXX. '' These obvious errors should have raised serious concerns about the validity of the charge, yet Wells Fargo chose to uphold it without questioning the legitimacy of the documentation.

2. Failure to Acknowledge Merchant Admission of Error : I conducted my own investigation via online chat with XXXX XXXX Initially, they claimed that the charge was due to inaccurate dimensions or weight of the shipment. After I provided the correct information, they changed their explanation, stating the charge was related to an extended area surcharge by XXXX. I verified that this claim was false by checking the zip code on the XXXX website, which confirmed it was not classified as an extended area. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX eventually admitted that the charge was invalid and assured me that a refund would be processed. In a later communication, XXXX XXXX informed me that " the funds should have been charged back to your account by now. If you havent received the refund yet, please check with your bank to confirm the transaction status. '' Despite this admission and assurance, I have yet to receive the refund after more than three months.

4. Wells Fargo 's Unwillingness to Redo the Investigation : Despite overwhelming evidence, including the fraudulent receipt, XXXX XXXX admission of error, and the communication indicating that a refund should have been processed, Wells Fargo has refused a thorough investigation of my case. Their response has been dismissive and fails to address the core issues I raised, further exacerbating the situation. 

*Request for Refund of Interest Charged : As a result of Wells Fargo 's failure to properly handle this dispute, I have been charged interest on this fraudulent transaction. I request that Wells Fargo not only re-open and thoroughly investigate this dispute but also credit back any interest that has accrued due to this unjustified charge. 

*Conclusion : I believe Wells Fargo has acted irresponsibly by failing to protect me from a fraudulent charge and by not performing the due diligence required in handling my dispute. Their actions have left me without a resolution and have caused unnecessary frustration and financial harm. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I submitted a written request to American Express opting out of them reporting any personal information to third parties upon reviewing my consumer credit report on XX/XX/XXXX. I noticed that they have continue to report to third-party companies being XXXX and XXXX are both non-affiliate third party companies. I called American Express calling the number provided on the report on XX/XX/XXXX at around XXXX XXXX while talking to a representative in the credit bureau unit telephone number XXXX, after speaking with several other reps this particular representative after informing him of my previous request that was sent via mail of me opting out and that i would like to place the same request via phone he informed me that no such request can be made. He stated that is not an option that is available. After informing him that I would like to exercise my right of the Privacy Act of 1974, 15 USC 6802 and 15 USC 6805, 16 CFR 313.7 he continued to inform me that that was not an option for me. American Express has treated me very unfairly. They are providing customers with inaccurate information and violating their rights. They are unfair and have deceptive acts and they are training their employees to be deceitful and lie to consumers, the rep informed me that he is following company policy. Several of my rights have been violated. The account that is appearing on my consumer credit report also states that it is a charged off account a charged off account is considered a certificate of indebtedness which means it is income, and income can not be reported on consumer credit reports per irs publication. therefore it must be removed. I have spoke to several representatives of American Express and several departments, and they have all giving me the runaround either by transferring my call to another representative or by providing me with different numbers so I can reach out to them on my own behalf. A few of the numbers provided were XXXX XXXX XXXX which was the credit bureau unit for American Express XXXX Even after me submitting my opt out request via mail written and calling to verify receipt of said request American Express has chosen to not obey the law. They continued to report inaccurate information and they have also provided transaction history providing third parties with non public information. The law says it is illegal to report transaction history and they have.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was mailed a promotional offer to accept the Chase credit card along with a {$200.00} cashback bonus when I purchased {$500.00} in the first three months. This was an insert included in the mailing. When I went online to complete the application, this offer was also promoted on the Chase website. I completed the application including a balance transfer, at which time I did not know what my credit limit would be, so I entered a transfer of {$3000.00}. I was accepted for the card and my credit limit was only {$1600.00} and the balance transfer was posted at $ XXXX. Once I found that out, I called Chase to reduce the transfer to {$1000.00} so I would be able to make the {$500.00} in purchases to qualify for the {$200.00} cashback offer. 
Reviewing my statement after the three months I realized that I was not credited the {$200.00} as promised. I called Chase customer service three different times. The first time, I was told that if I could provide the offer number, they would credit my account. Unfortunately, there was no offer number listed and I did not keep the application that was mailed to me after being accepted for the card. I explained about receiving the mailings promoting this offer and that the offer was still being promoted on the website for the same exact credit card. The next time I called, I was told that this offer is not available for my account. 
The next thing I did was send a secure message to Chase on XX/XX/year>. I explained that I received the offer in the mailing that was sent to me and also when I finished the application online it was clearly stated on the Chase website. I provided screenshots of the information that was promoted on the Chase website in XXXX when I applied for the card and also in XXXX, when the current promotion was still being offered. I was again told that this offer was not available for my account. No other explanation was given. I sent four different messages, XXXX on XX/XX/year>, another on XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, and the last one was XX/XX/year> of which I got no response. In all the communications I am asking why my account is not available for this offer. It is the same exact credit card that is being promoted with this {$200.00} cashback offer on {$500.00} purchases in the first three months of opening. This offer is still being promoted on the Chase website today. The only answer I received is that my account is not available for this offer. I also did research online and it seems like a lot of other people are having this problem with Chase where they are not receiving the {$200.00} cashback bonus offer that was promised. This promotion was the main reason I accepted the Chase credit card. I received many different offers from different credit card companies but decided to go with Chase because of this specific offer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Account number : XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Violation of the law. Pursuant 15 USC 1681a 2 ( A ) ( i ). Delete these accounts or remove the late payments to protect your company from lawsuits.

NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL To Whom It May Concern : I recently received a copy of my XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX consumer report, and I noticed you NATIONAL FINANCE CO 230 are reporting my transactions and experiences specifically late payments that you have posted on my consumer report from multiple accounts : Your company is in clear violation of the law. Pursuant 15 USC 1681a 2 ( A ) ( i ) EXCLUSIONS- Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) a report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions between the consumer ( ME ) and the person ( YOU ) NATIONAL FINANCE CO 230 Making the report is NOT INCLUDED on my Consumer report! 


Late payment is a transactional history, My HISTORY with your company. CONGRESS clearly states that the reporting of Transactions or experiences between the CONSUMER and the PERSON making the report is not included in the consumer reports!

YOU HAVE VIOLATED THE FCRA 15USC 1681a 2Ai by reporting this transaction or experience on my consumer which CONGRESS clearly states IS NOT included on my CONSUMER REPORTS.

You have 10 calendar days to update my Transaction/Payment history and DELETE all late payments from the accounts listed in this letter and all accounts listed on my credit reports from your company.

Consumer complaint narrative: Using the Etrade online portal, I requested on XX/XX/XXXX that my account be closed and that the balance be transferred to my XXXX XXXX account. On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email notification from Etrade that the funds transfer was complete. On XX/XX/XXXX, I recieved an email notification from XXXX XXXX that my XXXX  account had been closed on XX/XX/XXXX because I had a XXXX balance. Then I discovered that I could no longer fully access my ETrade account online. When I logged in to Etrade, an info-box said that restrictions had been placed on my account and that they could only be removed if I called them. I received no further information from Etrade until I contacted them on XX/XX/XXXX. I had a hard time reaching them sooner by phone due to long hold times. The rep I talked to told me that I needed to upload a copy of my photo ID with a signed letter stating the reason that the transfer was returned ( because unbeknownst to me XXXX had already closed my account with them ). As I kept asking questions and not getting satisfactory answers, the Etrade rep was impatient and dismissive and actually hung up on me. I still immediately uploaded the requested letter ( typed with an electronic signature ) with my ID. I didn't hear from Etrade again until I initiated an online chat on XX/XX/XXXX to ask why my account still had not been closed. The chat lasted more than an hour. I was told that my uploaded documents had been rejected and that I should have been notified of this. ( I had not been notified. ). They used vague terms, stating for example that my documents were " not in good order. '' I repeatedly asked clarifying questions about what this meant, which they refused to answer. Throughout the chat, which I can provide the transcript of, I was given confusing and contradictory instructions about what the problem was and what they were requiring. I was told that the letter had to be handwritten ( not just a wet signature, but the entire letter ). This was later contradicted in the chat by a different representative. Still, I submitted a new handwritten letter and was told they were not requiring anything further and that my request would be processed within a couple of days and that a check for the balance in my account would be mailed to me. Again, I heard nothing from Etrade and initiated another online chat today. I was told that my photo ID was not legible. When I complained that I had already submitted it multiple times, I was told that the photo ID I had submitted was ok after all. Then I was told that I need to submit a bank statement from XXXX XXXX proving that that account was closed. i asked why this was necessary and why I was not told of this requirement before. They would not answer those questions and just said that it's protocol. The rules and requirements just keep changing and all I'm asking for is that my account be closed. I have literally spent hours trying to get my account closed and it is not clear why they will not close it. I do not believe a bank statement from another bank should be required.

I am writing to urgently escalate a matter previously addressed in complaints filed on XX/XX/year> ( CFPB Ref No : XXXX ), and XX/XX/year> ( CFPB Ref No : XXXX ), concerning American Expresss incorrect reporting of a business credit card to my personal credit report.

The responses from American Express, including the most recent dated XX/XX/year>, have failed to address my specific concerns about the absence of a personal guarantee. Notably, after XXXX XXXX initial response in XX/XX/year>, where they did not validate the account as a personal obligation, the account was removed from my personal credit report, only to resurface recently, contradicting the previous resolution. 

Additionally, this account never reported to my personal credit while it was current. It only appeared on my personal credit report after the business defaulted on the payment, which was later paid in full. The business associated with this card has fully paid the owed amount. Despite this, the account is erroneously being reported as a charge-off on my personal credit report. 

The re-emergence of this account and its incorrect status on my personal credit files is perplexing and alarming, especially since the documentation provided, including statements and a copy of the application information, does not constitute a binding personal agreement or evidence of a personal guarantee on my part. As the card was signed and used strictly in my capacity as a XXXX XXXXXXXX of XXXX XXXX, and no personal guarantee was signed, it is inappropriate and erroneous to report this business debt on my personal credit files. 

Furthermore, American Express has failed to validate this account properly, violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) multiple times. In their validation attempts, they merely sent statements, which do not prove that I personally guaranteed the account. This alone is sufficient reason for the immediate removal of this account from my personal credit report.
