Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I called Smith Debnam Narron Drake Saintsing and Myers, LLP regarding a letter they sent for a debt their Client XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX indicated I owed. When speaking with the representative on a recorded line, I first attempted to determine a payment arrangement. In response, the representative advised I could pay the debt off over a three ( 3 ) month period ( totaling {$1700.00} or so per month ). I advised that I could not afford that and inquired further and was told I could stretch it out over a year but in order to do that payment arrangement I must sign a document ( confession of judgment ) admitting to owing the debt, waiving any rights I XXXX have, and agree to have this filed in with the court. The representative then advised that after I sign this document and allowed them to file it in Court as a judgment, I could then begin repayment arrangements. This seemed deceptive as we began talking about possible payment arrangements, but the representative switched and told me oh yeah if you want to do this payment arrange, you can only do so by giving up your rights. I did not agree to this because I quickly understood I would be giving up all my rights to which the representative confirmed I would no longer have any defenses against the debt, but I could then begin repayment. I then stated I would never waive my rights and I indicated to the representative that the debt has been paid to the original creditor anyway, so I do not owe. In response, the representative confirmed that but then said that their client, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has not been paid. I responded with " I am not sure your Client has the right to collect on the debt. '' The representative then responded that I could call XXXX and obtain that information if I wanted. I responded that I am not required to do that but he is. 
I am not certain if the representatives at this law firm collecting on debt are monitored or trained but their debt collection practices are deceptive and they need training. Further, there is no reason the only way you can have anywhere near affordable payments requires you to agree to have a judgment entered in against you giving up all of your rights. I want proof that their Client has the right to collect on the debt. Specifically, the contract, the purchase amount and agreement.
Company public response: None

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: I used my Wells Fargo credit card to load money into my XXXX account. I did not realize this transaction would be a cash advance, and would be charged interest as such. Wells Fargo did waive the initial cash advance fee and interest fee, which I appreciated because I made a mistake, however, I asked if all I needed to do was to pay my next statement balance in full to avoid paying any future interest, they said yes. I received another interest fee, due to the standing cash advance, which they waived again, and then I immediately paid of my whole statement in full to clear both cash advance and general credit card balance. Here is the issue, there is no separate line item in my Wells Fargo mobile app for current cash advance balance. The cash advance itself looks the same as any other credit card transaction, however the interest treatment is different than a credit card transaction, since interest occurs from the date of advance instead after carrying a balance ( like a normal credit card transaction ). Luckily, I pay attention to these things and I was able to rectify my mistake which Wells Fargo did assist me with, no issues there. However, not explicitly calling out cash advance current balance nor giving an option to explicitly pay off that balance as its own separate credit type, is predatory. I am sure many consumers are paying at least 2 months of interest if not more for a cash advance balance they do not know they have, and if different transaction types carry different interest treatments, they should be separated out. Thank you.

Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) to dispute an item of inaccurate information contained in my credit report, which your company has verified. The inaccurate data in question pertains to the open date associated with the account XXXX listed on my credit report. 
I have recently obtained a copy of my credit report from XXXX, and upon careful review, it has come to my attention that the open date for the aforementioned account is still inaccurate. I never opened an account with neither XXXX XXXX nor Helvey & Associates in XXXX XXXX XXXXhis discrepancy has a negative impact on my creditworthiness and financial reputation. I have been denied credit and housing due to this error. 
I believe this error can be traced back XXXX, not the original creditor or a previous debt collector who sold the credit file. However, as the current data verifier, your organization is responsible for ensuring the accuracy of information it furnishes to credit reporting agencies, as outlined in Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA. 
Having identified this discrepancy, seeing as though Ive already kindly requested that you investigate and correct this information promptly, I now request this record be removed from my credit file as it is a violation of my rights and can be punishable with a {$1000.00} fine. The FCRA stipulates that consumer reporting agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation within 30 days of receiving a notice of dispute. I can no longer trust that you will undertake this investigation promptly, considering my rights as a consumer and your lawful obligations have already been violated. 
Please note that the inaccurate reporting of this account 's open date has a direct impact on my creditworthiness, financial standing, and overall consumer experience. Additionally, I request that you inform all credit reporting agencies to whom you have previously provided this erroneous information, as per Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA. 
I am sure that you understand the importance of maintaining accurate credit information, not only to protect my rights as a consumer but also to ensure the fair and efficient functioning of our credit reporting system. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I hope that we can resolve this dispute amicably and ensure the accuracy of my credit report. Your cooperation and timely response are greatly appreciated.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Company: Helvey & Associates, Inc., Warsaw, IN Branch

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Violation of Consumer Rights by American Express I am writing to file a formal complaint against American Express for what I believe to be a violation of my consumer rights. Specifically, I am concerned about their handling of my credit reporting information without providing me with a proper method to opt out, and their unauthorized sale of my credit report and personal information to a collection agency. 

Despite my repeated attempts to address this matter directly with American Express, I have not received a satisfactory resolution. Therefore, I am seeking your assistance in addressing this issue and ensuring that my consumer rights are upheld. 

My concerns are as follows : 1. Lack of Opt-Out Method : American Express never provided me with a clear method to opt out of credit reporting. As a consumer, I believe I have the right to control how my credit information is shared and used, but American Express has not honored this right. 

2. Unauthorized Sale of Credit Report : I recently discovered that American Express sold my credit report and personal information to a collection agency without my written consent. This action is not only a breach of my privacy but also a violation of consumer protection laws. 

I have documentation to support my claims, including correspondence with American Express and records of the unauthorized sale of my credit report. I would be happy to provide these documents to assist with your investigation. 

I kindly request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate action against American Express for their actions. I also ask that you ensure that American Express implements measures to prevent similar violations in the future and provide me with compensation for any damages incurred. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Urgent Request for Documentation and Action Regarding Unauthorized Inquiry and Security Interest Dear TD Auto Finance, I am writing to address a concerning matter regarding an inquiry reported by TD Auto Finance, which lacks permissible purpose and, as such, constitutes potential identity fraud. Per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Sections 604 and 605B, I am requesting immediate action to rectify this situation. 

Firstly, I require documentation proving that I provided express written consent for TD Auto Finance to report the inquiry in question. As there is no evidence of such consent or a court order, I must assert that this inquiry lacks legitimacy and is thus subject to removal.

Per the FCRA Section 605B, a consumer reporting agency must block the reporting of any information resulting from alleged identity theft when identified by the consumer. Therefore, I am formally notifying TD Auto Finance to remove this inquiry from my file within four business days. 

Furthermore, it has come to my attention that XXXX XXXX neglected to inform me of my right to rescission, as outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), specifically Regulation Z ( 12 CFR 1026.23 ). This allows me to revoke any rights waived, particularly those related to the security interest. I am requesting the CUSIP number associated with the security interest provided to TD Auto Finance. Failure to provide this information will leave me with no alternative but to initiate a level 3 audit on my account.

I expect prompt compliance with these requests to avoid further escalation of this matter. Failure to do so will be regarded as willful noncompliance and may result in legal action.

Please provide confirmation of receipt of this letter and a timeline for resolution of these issues.

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a HELOC with TD Bank that I'm looking to have paid off and closed. 

I requested information from the bank for how to get a Verification of Mortgage from TD. 

I received a response bank from their digital team with instructions. 

I followed the instructions provided and the loan processor sent in the verification request. 

The f

irst 3 requests did not get a response. The 4 request I was told, could not
be processed due to not having a specific verification form filled out. Even though the instructions provide to me by TD Bank originally stated I just needed to send them a letter. I spoke to a representative who repeatedly told me that a letter is not acceptable and that I need to have the specific form signed and resend it in to her attention and she would call if there were any problems. 

I called 2 days later after not receiving a call from the representative asking for the status of the document and was told that since my signature on the request does not match the original document from 2018 they can not process my request. 

I explained that my signature has changed since then and what can I do to get this corrected, they stated that without a signature match there was nothing I can do. 

I understand that my signature is not the same as 2018, but I still need my verification of mortgage request completed somehow. TD Bank as a company is unable to tell me what I can do to get this requested resolved. They are giving me no other option to get me verified so that this VOM can be sent. 

I have been verified by TD over the phone, through their VoicePrint service and the secure text codes, so they are able to verify who I am. 

After speaking with numerous representatives it appears that no one is able to assist. I have been told we can " try this or try that '' but no one can tell me what needs to be done to get this processed. I've received different answers from most of the representatives I spoke to. 

The bank is causing me financial strain as I am trying to make these payments each month and the payments have increased significantly due to interest rates. 

I feel as if TD is intentionally delaying the payoff and closing of my loan so they can continue to collect the high interest payments from me and keep this loan on the books. 

As a top US Bank TD should have clear and simple instructions to provide to a customer when handling their requests.
Company public response: None

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
American Express made an offer for an extension of credit in exchange for a note ( 12 CFR 360.6 ). I accepted this offer and returned the note. I paid for the goods and service via the note, and became an investor in their company. XXXX XXXX XXXX. They have accepted my note, then claimed I did not qualify, Although this is a clear violation of 12 CFR 1002.6 ( a ) I informed them that the information used to determine this was inaccurate, and that we already have a contract. I informed them that this is a violation of the equal credit opportunity act, and that their own prospectus states they can not guarantee the accuracy of their credit worthiness determinations. I made an investment in American Express and they have taken my securities without providing the goods that I paid for. This is Securities Fraud. They have sent responses that appear to be automated and in no way have acknowledged my claim. 

I am a victim of American Express deceptive practices. By telling the SEC they are treating their investors one way, but the whole time clearly mistreating their investors. American Express clearly told the SEC in their Prospectus on page S-5 " We do not intend to apply for listing of the notes on any securities exchange or for quotation through any automated dealer quotation system ' I Applied for American Express card XX/XX/XXXX and their denial states " Thank you for applying for American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX We are writing to let you know that, unfortunately, we can not approve your application at this time. Reason ( s ) for Our Decision Your XXXX score ( see below ) Information About Your XXXX Score We obtained your XXXX score from XXXX and used it in making our credit decision '' The detail of my application for credit is discriminatory and violates my privacy 15 U.S. Code 1691 - Scope of prohibition * U.S. Code * Notes ( a ) Activities constituting discrimination It shall be unlawful for any creditor to discriminate against any applicant, with respect to any aspect of a credit transaction VIOLATED 12 CFR Part 1002 - Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( Regulation B ) MOST RECENTLY AMENDED XXXX XXXX, XXXX Regulation B protects applicants from discrimination in any aspect of a credit transaction. VIOLATED The Privacy Act The FOIA/Privacy Act Division, in the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Public Affairs ( ASPA ), is the focal point for HHS Privacy Act administration, including the HHS System of Records Notices ( SORNs ) and Computer Matching Agreements ( CMAs ). The Privacy Act of 1974, as amended to present, including Statutory Notes ( 5 U.S.C. 552a ), Protects records about individuals retrieved by personal identifiers such as a name, social security number, or other identifying number or symbol. An individual has rights under the Privacy Act to seek access to and request correction ( if applicable ) or an accounting of disclosures of any such records maintained about him or her. Prohibits disclosure of such records without the prior, written consent of the individual ( s ) to whom the records pertain, unless one of the twelve disclosure exceptions enumerated in subsection ( b ) of the Act applies 15 U.S. Code 1681 - Congressional findings and statement of purpose a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting The Congress makes the following findings : ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.

( b ) Reasonable procedures It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. 
As you can see there is a need to protect your right to privacy.

Important Definitions from 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction The term consumer reporting agency means any person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing consumer reports. 
The term consumer means an individual. 
The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living ( 2 ) Exclusions ( A ) ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ; AMERICAN EXPRESS transferred my application to third parties that compensated them which means they received benefits, see : pg. S-27 of their Prospectus Reporting Transaction history is illegal 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
They need your written consent to add anything to your consumer report if you did not give this authorization that is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act P.L 90-321 ( 82 Stat. 146 ) which is law law that backes the code is even stricter as it states that any agency can only get your report in response to a request by the head of a State or local child support enforcement agency ( or a State or local government official authorized by the head of such an agency ) 15 U.S. Code 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 
No adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be on your report any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports this is another violation 12 CFR 1022.3 Definitions Identity theft means a fraud committed or attempted using the identifying information of another person without authority. 
Anything added to your report without your written consent could be considered Identity theft 15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

If you chose to list that in your complaint YOU MUST provide the information listed above. Identity theft reports can be filed with the Federal Trade Commission on their website 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures ( a ) Identity and purposes of credit users Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. These procedures shall require that prospective users of the information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. Every consumer reporting agency shall make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective user prior to furnishing such user a consumer report. No consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report to any person if it has reasonable grounds for believing that the consumer report will not be used for a purpose listed in section 1681b of this title.

( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

By violating section 1681b for permissible purpose and 1681c for information contained in consumer reports they are also violating compliance procedures under this title. 
15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ( a ) In general Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00} ; or ( B ) in the case of liability of a natural person for obtaining a consumer report under false pretenses or knowingly without a permissible purpose, actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or {$1000.00}, whichever is greater ; If you can prove they wilfully violated the act you are entitled to at least XXXX $ per violation plus any other damages you have sustained as a result of their failure to follow the law. If you have to file more than 1 complaint, wilful noncompliance can easily be proven as they had a full understanding of the violations after you complained the 1st time. 

Every company in their agreements with consumers said they would follow the law and agreed to do so.They are aware that they are breaking the law. 
15 U.S. Code 1681o - Civil liability for negligent noncompliance In general Any person who is negligent in failing to comply with any requirement imposed under this subchapter with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure Negligent noncompliance means the law was violated not on purpose but just due to a lack of knowledge on the required reporting procedures.

15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( 1 ) Prohibition ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

Once you notify the consumer agencies that there is inaccurate information they must immediately stop reporting that information until they can prove that it is valid.

Those are a few violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act that you can use in your complaint against not only the reporting agencies but the furnisher of that information to them.

Privacy Act of 1974 ( 5 U.S. Code 552a ) Important Definitions ( 4 ) the term record means any item, collection, or grouping of information about an individual that is maintained by an agency, including, but not limited to, his education, financial transactions, medical history, and criminal or employment history and that contains his name, or the identifying number, symbol, or other identifying particular assigned to the individual, such as a finger or voice print or a photograph ; This includes consumer reports ( b ) Conditions of Disclosure.No agency shall disclose any record which is contained in a system of records by any means of communication to any person, or to another agency, except pursuant to a written request by, or with the prior written consent of, the individual to whom the record pertains, unless disclosure of the record would be ( 12 ) to a consumer reporting agency in accordance with section 3711 ( e ) of title 31.

Again they need prior written instruction of the individual to whom it relates.

Section 3711 ( e ) of title 31 States ( 1 ) When trying to collect a claim of the Government under a law except the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 ( 26 U.S.C. 1 et seq. ), the head of an executive, judicial, or legislative agency shall disclose to a consumer reporting agency information from a system of records that a person is responsible for a claim if ( E ) the head of the agency has established procedures to ( iii ) get satisfactory assurances from each consumer reporting agency that the agency is complying with all laws of the United States related to providing consumer credit information ; and Either way they have violated not only the Fair Credit Reporting Act but also the Privacy Act of 1974 Opt Out Laws PART 1016 - PRIVACY OF CONSUMER FINANCIAL INFORMATION ( REGULATION P ) 12 CFR 1016.1 Purpose and scope.

( a ) Purpose. This part governs the treatment of nonpublic personal information about consumers by the financial institutions listed in paragraph ( b ) of this section. This part : ( 1 ) Requires a financial institution to provide notice to customers about its privacy policies and practices ; ( 2 ) Describes the conditions under which a financial institution may disclose nonpublic personal information about consumers to nonaffiliated third parties ; and ( 3 ) Provides a method for consumers to prevent a financial institution from disclosing that information to most nonaffiliated third parties by opting out of that disclosure, subject to the exceptions in 1016.13, 1016.14, and 1016.15.

Every company owes you a privacy notice before they furnish any information to our consumer report 12 CFR 1016.4 Initial privacy notice to consumers required.

( a ) Initial notice requirement. You must provide a clear and conspicuous notice that accurately reflects your privacy policies and practices to : ( 1 ) Customer. An individual who becomes your customer, not later than when you establish a customer relationship, except as provided in paragraph ( e ) of this section; and ( 2 ) Consumer. A consumer, before you disclose any nonpublic personal information about the consumer to any nonaffiliated third party, 12 CFR 1016.7 Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods. Section ( a ) ( 1 ) Form of opt out notice. If you are required to provide an opt out notice under 1016.10 ( a ), you must provide a clear and conspicuous notice to each of your consumers that accurately explains the right to opt out under that section. The notice must state : ( i ) That you disclose or reserve the right to disclose nonpublic personal information about your consumer to a nonaffiliated third party ; ( ii ) That the consumer has the right to opt out of that disclosure; and ( iii ) A reasonable means by which the consumer may exercise the opt out right.

( 2 ) Examples ( ii ) Reasonable opt out means. You provide a reasonable means to exercise an opt out right if you : ( A ) Designate check-off boxes in a prominent position on the relevant forms with the opt out notice ; ( B ) Include a reply form together with the opt out notice that, in the case of financial institutions described in 1016.3 ( l ) ( 3 ) of this part, includes the address to which the form should be mailed ; ( C ) Provide an electronic means to opt out, such as a form that can be sent via electronic mail or a process at your Web site, if the consumer agrees to the electronic delivery of information ; or ( D ) Provide a toll-free telephone number that consumers may call to opt out.

( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right; or ( B ) The only means of opting out as described in any notice subsequent to the initial notice is to use a check-off box that you provided with the initial notice but did not include with the subsequent notice.

( g ) Time to comply with opt out. You must comply with a consumer 's opt out direction as soon as reasonably practicable after you receive it.

( h ) Continuing right to opt out. A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time.

( i ) Duration of consumer 's opt out direction.

( 1 ) A consumer 's direction to opt out under this section is effective until the consumer revokes it in writing or, if the consumer agrees, electronically.

15 U.S. Code 6802 - Obligations with respect to disclosures of personal information ( a ) Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.

( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.

Once again they must give you an opt out notice for anything that is to be added to your consumer report. 
15 U.S. Code 6805 - Enforcement ( a ) In general Subject to subtitle B of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 [ 12 U.S.C. 5511 et seq. ], this subchapter and the regulations prescribed thereunder shall be enforced by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, the Federal functional regulators, the State insurance authorities, and the Federal Trade Commission with respect to financial institutions and other persons subject to their jurisdiction under applicable law, You have the right to opt out of anything on your report at any time and the companies must comply as soon as reasonably practicable after you send them a notice. They have given you unreasonable means to opt out so you will have to write your own letter directing them to stop reporting in accordance with the laws listed above.

Consumer complaint narrative: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

But the IT people from the online service, probably could have helped but they keep saying they don't see any of my documents to grant me access. So, where do we go from here? Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX, my checking account was hacked. At the time, I did not know because Wells Fargo did not send a text nor call me to let me know that there was some unusual activity going on with my account. Before they were done, the hackers had moved {$36000.00} from my other accounts ( Wells Fargo Visa card, Line of Credit, and Savings ) all into my checking account. Before they moved the money, the hackers hijacked my computer with some sort of virus. I also think they had access to my cell phone #. Because when I called " XXXX XXXX XXXX' for help. I did not know I was talking to the hackers. Unfortunately, they convinced me that the {$10000.00} that was showing up in my checking account was not mine and belonged to another persons " XXXX '' account and that it was a crime to keep the money and the only way to get out of this was to return the money to that person 's XXXX account. So, still thinking I am talking with XXXX XXXX the person convinced me to withdraw the {$10000.00} from my bank and wire it back to them so they could return it to the rightful owner. I fell for the scam. I finally realized I was being scammed when I later saw another {$15000.00} in my checking account ( I am still on the phone with the hackers ). The hackers then asked me to send them that {$15000.00} that had just showed up in my checking account. I still did not realize that the money was in fact from my other accounts but I knew it was a scam when they asked me to go to a different branch and withdraw the {$15000.00}. I refused. The person became angry and stated they were going to turn me in to the police. After calling Wells Fargo, they froze my accounts and issued new account # 's and started their investigation. At the end of their investigation, they stated they had returned {$26000.00} of the disputed {$36000.00} to my accounts. The remaining {$10000.00} they could not return because I authorized the transaction. They also returned {$300.00} in fees and interest the hackers created. They have not returned an additional {$510.00} in fees and interest. When I ask why, I did not get an answer that made sense. One customer service rep says it would be returned with a couple of days. Another says it will take up to 3 months. On XX/XX/XXXX I checked my Wells Fargo Visa Credit card ( they placed the {$10000.00} I mistakenly gave to the hackers in this account ) and I saw that they had made an adjustment and gave me a credit for the entire {$10000.00}. Of course, I was a happy person. Unfortunately, the very next day they made another adjustment and said I again owed {$10000.00}. Which in my mind was a cruel gesture on their part. When I asked why this happened they would neither answer my question nor let me speak with anyone who was actually connected with me claim. I understand not wanting to credit me the entire {$10000.00}. However, I believe that Wells Fargo could have done some things on their end to help me the consumer ( again text or a phone call call about unusual activity ) and give me credit for part of the {$10000.00}. I also believe it should not be that difficult to quickly return to me the {$510.00} of fees and interest.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
We have our account set up for automatic monthly payments + {$100.00}. So far, every month, the autodraft has not included the extra {$100.00}. Even so, the principal balance should not be going up while we are making payments on it. 

The autodraft went through on XX/XX/XXXX. I have included a screenshot of our checking account activity for that week. In it, you can clearly see a payment of {$690.00}. At the end of XXXX ( I believe it was the XXXX ), I noticed that our loan account was flagged as 19 days delinquent. Our statement ( XXXX nonsense round XXXX ) showed a number of payments and reversals that are in no way reflected in our checking account. We called Wells Fargo, and were told that they could see the error, and would investigate. They expected it to take 5 business days, and we would receive something in the mail. We never received any mail. 

The autodraft for XXXX did not go through on the XXXX. We called on the XXXX, and were told that it was because the system erroneously believed we had made extra payments in XXXX, and had no balance due. I specifically asked if I should make a payment, and was told not to by a Wells Fargo employee. We were told that she was opening a second investigation into our account, which would take 5 business days. 

On the XXXX, our account was again flagged as delinquent. We called Wells Fargo and made a payment over the phone, and were again told that our account was being investigated to see why this was happening. 

Today, on the XXXX, our loan account shows an increasing number of fake transactions on the XXXX ( XXXX nonsense round XXXX ). Again, none of these transactions are in any way reflected in our checking account. This appears to be a system error entirely on the loan account. 

Adding insult to injury, I am including our statements from XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, as well as a screenshot from our loan account page. The principle balance in XX/XX/XXXX was {$22000.00}. As of this morning, it is {$23000.00}. 

We made payments in XXXX and XXXX. Why do we owe more money now than we did in XXXX? 

We no longer have faith in Wells Fargo correcting this error. We need the Consumer Finance Protection Bureau to step in and make this right.

Wellsfargo Bank NA sent me a notice that I was enrolled in identity theft protection without my knowledge or consent after reviewing my information. When I called in they found other accounts that were ooenef for bill pay, insurance etc without my knowledge. Upon thorough review of the 12 accounts included with dates opened and closed in the offer, namely : - XXXX Bill pay - XXXX Checking - XXXX Savings - XXXX Checking - XXXX Checking - XXXX Checking - XXXX Savings - XXXX Savings - XXXX Identify theft protection - XXXX Identify theft protection - XXXX Insurance - XXXX Insurance It has become evident that the harm caused by the identified cases of identity theft far exceeds the proposed amount. Each of these accounts represents a breach of trust and a significant violation of personal security. The dates shown in the letter detail a pattern of harm and are tied to the decline in my personal information and credit. 

Identity theft is not merely a financial inconvenience ; it inflicts profound emotional distress and undermines one 's sense of security. The unauthorized access to personal information and financial accounts results in a loss of privacy and exposes individuals to the risk of further exploitation and fraudulent activity. Moreover, the time and resources required to rectify the damage caused by identity theft impose additional burdens and disrupt normalcy in daily life. 
I would like the company to make me whole and fairly compensate me for this breach of my personal information. They offered me an amount that does not resolve or cure the issue. The company has admitted fault and this issue falls under sales practices which is similar to when the company opened up false checking and savings accounts in the past, this issue also falls under identity theft as there were two insurance account opened up and used from XXXX without my consent.

I called in a second time and spoke wit ha 4th person, XXXX the account Supervisor in XXXX, MI with Chase Credit Card Services and she told me that the following rules apply : After the Interest Saving Balance is paid in full, any amount paid above that balance will go to : 1. The Highest APR payment ( doesn't apply because the MY CHASE PLANs are interest free, but instead use monthly fees ) Then the payments will be applied in this order of rules : - The remaining number of payments from lowest to highest ( # of months ) - The plan from earliest created to newest ( only after the first criteria is met ) This means that if I were to pay the same amount as the remaining balance on the XXXX plan, it would not be paid and I would still have the monthly fee of {$22.00} tied to it. However, it would end up closing out the payments with the smallest balance and the least amount due which are not my concern. 

When I asked for a copy of this documentation, she relayed that it was on their employee site and could not be shared.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023, I deposited three checks drawn on other domestic financial institutions totaling {$2200.00} in person to a teller at the branch located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, NC during normal branch hours. 

The checks posted to my account and Chase made available {$200.00} of the deposit on the same day. Pursuant to Regulation CC, Chase should have made an additional {$25.00} ( for a total of {$220.00} of the deposit ) available on XX/XX/2023 to comply with the next-day availability rule. Then, Chase should have made the entire remaining amount available on XX/XX/2023, to comply with 229.12 ( b ) ( 1 ). 

However, Chase has instead failed to make any more of the remaining {$2000.00} available. At the time of deposit, the teller informed me that the bank may take " up to XX/XX/2023 '' to make this amount available. Several reasons for an " exception hold '' are provided in Reg CC that would allow this, but I do not believe that any of them apply to this deposit. 

My account has existed for more than 30 days, so it is not a new account. Nor was this a large deposit, as the aggregate check deposit for the entire day was less than {$5500.00}. My account has never been overdrawn at any bank, and I do not have any outstanding liabilities to Chase. None of the checks were redeposited, and no emergency conditions appear to have existed. 

The only remaining exception would require that Chase have relied on the " existence of facts that would cause a well-grounded belief in the mind of a reasonable person '' that the check would be returned unpaid by the drawer 's bank. Upon information and belief, the drawer of the {$2000.00} check maintains an account in good standing with the paying bank, has never overdrawn an account with any bank, and did not write a bad check. Therefore, I do not believe that Chase possessed such evidence. 

Moreover, even if an exception did apply, Chase did not specifically state which exception is used for the hold as required by regulation, nor the specific evidence used in this case to make a determination of reasonable cause to doubt collectibility, if that was the exception relied on.
Company public response: None

Prior to this I submitted payment : - XX/XX/XXXX {$1000.00}, email confirmed received XXXX, {$800.00}, email confirmed received XXXX, {$1000.00}, email confirmed received Total : {$2800.00} I am requesting that all late fees be reimbursed, that the 2 late payments be permanently removed from my credit report, and that my credit score be adjusted to what it was prior to those 2 marks. 

I have never missed a payment in over 7 years, this is the first incident, and it is not even my fault. My highest score in XXXX was XXXX before all this. I appreciate your understanding and help to resolve this dispute and reinstate my correct credit score.

Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you without properly notifying you of lawsuit
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, while living in XXXX, GA, I was contacted about a debt by the law firm of Zwicker and associates ( XXXX ), with whom I set up a payment arrangement. The original debt balance was {$5600.00}. I contacted XXXX XXXX  who informed me that the debt had gone to collections and they had no further information. The paralegal at Zwicker with whom I spoke told me after I had made a couple of payments that because of COVID XXXX XXXX  ( the debtor ) was suspending payments and probably dismissing them in light of financial hardships. I was told that Zwicker would notify me when or if payments would resume. I have since moved to North Carolina. 
Approximately a year later in XXXX I was served with a notice that a judgement had been found against me. I was given no notice that this was considered and it was a complete surprise. I tried contacting Zwicker and was given a run around without any one person explaining why or how a judgement could be placed against me without any notification or offer to begin repayment. 
Since then, I had not had any further contact from Zwicker until XXXX of XXXX when I checked my bank account and found that both my savings and checking accounts had been emptied and a hold was placed on my account. I contacted my bank who notified me that Zwicker had slammed my account, garnished my monies and placed a hold on the account. They could give me no further information and told me to contact Zwicker. When I called Zwicker, they told me that it was a legal hold and that I needed to talk to my bank. They also told me that they were unable to contact me which is funny since they were easily able to access my bank records. Further, I am not in hiding and my location is easy to determine. 
My issue its that Zwicker acted unscrupulously and without warning or notification after an extended time of no action to wipe out my entire savings and checking. I was given no notice that any action would be taken and since such an extended period had gone by without any action or notification, I had forgotten about the issue and assumed that the debt had been forgiven, as many credit card debts were at the time. To restate, Zwicker had told me that XXXX XXXX  was suspending payments and might forgive the debt do to the economic hardships caused by COVID. They told me that they would contact me at a later date regarding the status of the debt, which they never did. Almost three years later, they wiped my account clean without any warning or notification and froze my accounts. Since I had several automatic payments tied to my checking account, this put me in greater jeopardy. 
I have since learned that Zwicker and associates routinely acts in this manner without regard to the impact on my life and is regarded as one of the most unscrupulous firms in the business.
Company public response: None

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) ), it is imperative to ensure that consumer reporting agencies conduct their duties with fairness, impartiality, and a profound regard for the consumer 's privacy rights. XXXX and XXXX, recognized as consumer reporting agencies, hold sensitive consumer information, and I, as the consumer, assert my right to safeguard this information, as underscored by 15 USC 6801. This statute emphasizes Congress 's intent for financial institutions, including furnishers of information to credit agencies, to uphold a commitment to customer privacy and confidentiality.

Pertinently, 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) stipulates that consumer reporting agencies may only furnish consumer reports under specific circumstances, explicitly when directed by the consumer in writing. I have neither provided nor consented to the furnishing of my information to XXXX, XXXX, or any financial institution. Consequently, any form of consent, whether expressed verbally, non-verbally, or implied, is hereby revoked. 

Further reinforcing my position, 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) mandates that financial institutions must inform consumers of their right to exercise nondisclosure options. This obligation has not been fulfilled by the furnisher of information to credit agencies. Additionally, 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) strictly prohibits consumer reporting agencies from including adverse information in reports without authorization. The presence of such information on my account violates this provision, as well as 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) ( 1 ), which prohibits furnishing inaccurate consumer information.

Moreover, in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 1681e, consumer reporting agencies must establish reasonable procedures to prevent violations of consumer reporting laws. XXXX and XXXX have failed to fulfill this obligation. Additionally, as outlined in 12 CFR 1016.7, consumers retain the right to opt out of reporting services at any time. Therefore, I hereby exercise my right to opt out of : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Division TD Bank [ Address ] [ City, State, ZIP Code ] Dispute of Collection on Credit Report To Whom This May Concern I XXXX XXXX I hope this letter finds you in good health. I am writing to dispute a collection entry on my credit report, which I believe is inaccurately associated with my credit history. 

I recently reviewed my credit report from the three major credit bureaus, namely XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. To my surprise, I discovered a collection account that does not belong to me. I would like to bring to your attention that this entry violates the following consumer protection laws : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA mandates that credit bureaus maintain accurate and up-to-date information on consumers ' credit reports. In this case, the collection entry is erroneous and does not reflect my credit history accurately. 

2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The FDCPA prohibits debt collectors from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices. This includes reporting inaccurate information to credit bureaus, which has negatively impacted my creditworthiness. 

3. Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) : Under the FCBA, consumers have the right to dispute inaccurate charges and billing errors. The collection entry in question does not pertain to any debt that I have incurred, and therefore, it should be removed from my credit report. 

4. Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) : The FACTA ensures that consumers have access to their credit reports and have the ability to dispute inaccurate information. I have taken the necessary steps to review my credit report and am exercising my right to dispute this collection entry. 

I request that TD Bank, as the creditor, take immediate action to investigate and rectify this error. I kindly ask that you provide me with a written response within 30 days, acknowledging the receipt of this dispute and informing me of the actions taken to resolve the matter. 

In addition, I urge TD Bank to notify the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ) of the inaccuracy and request the removal of the collection entry from my credit reports. This action is essential in ensuring the accuracy of my credit history and maintaining my financial reputation. 

Please find attached copies of supporting documents, such as credit report excerpts highlighting the erroneous collection entry, as well as any other relevant information that may assist in the investigation process. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Should you require any further information or documentation, please do not hesitate to contact me at the provided phone number or email address. 

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. 

Consumer Financial Protection Division TD Bank
Company public response: None

It is cruelly ironic and very convenient for Chase that only after placing this purchase on my Chase card as opposed to my XXXX card, the quoted 12-month 1.72 % fee plan apparently doesn't exist. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I formally terminated my car contract using commercial paper. Concurrently, I revoked my Power of Attorney through a notarized revocation. Additionally, I dispatched a certified letter on the same date, exercising my rights under 15 USC 6802, explicitly opting out of reporting to any reporting agencies. 

Despite these actions, the company continued to report on my credit, thereby violating my consumer rights. They disseminated my information to multiple non-affiliated entities, which are not authorized credit reporting agencies ( XXXX and XXXX are reporting agencies, not credit bureaus ; the only credit bureau in the United States is the CFPB ). 

Furthermore, my Social Security number was transmitted to non-affiliated third parties without my consent. The term " nonaffiliated third party '' refers to any entity that is neither an affiliate nor related by common ownership or corporate control with the financial institution. 

The company has also sent unmarked letters in an attempt to collect a fictitious debt, which was already satisfied through UCC Tender of Payment. This constitutes fraud and harassment. Additionally, they have placed harassing phone calls despite my explicit instruction in a certified letter that all communication must be in writing. 

This behavior appears to be systemic within the company, suggesting a need for a forensic audit for securities fraud in addition to their routine violation of consumer rights as part of their daily operations.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I filed a claim with JP Morgan Chase regarding a merchant who withdrew more funds from my account than was agreed upon. I was instructed to visit a branch to sign an ACH Statement of Dispute, which I did. The branch bankers faxed the form, and I waited until XX/XX/year> to confirm the receipt. 

Upon calling on XX/XX/year>, I was informed by a representative that my claim had been denied due to " no dispute rights. '' The representative was unable to provide any substantial reasoning or explanation of what this meant. When I requested escalation, I was transferred to a team lead whose behavior was both unprofessional and condescending. This individual incorrectly asserted that my claim had been filed as a dispute for a cancelled transactionsomething I never communicated. 

I made it clear that my issue was the merchant withdrawing more money than authorized, not a fraudulent transaction or a dispute over cancellation. The team lead ignored my explanation, instead repeating that my claim was denied due to a " history with the merchant, '' which was irrelevant to my actual complaint. His dismissive and arrogant tone was uncalled for. After being placed on hold multiple times, the lead said I " didnt want to speak to someone else, just someone who would tell me what I wanted to hear, '' and then hung up on me. 

I called back and eventually spoke to a supervisor, only to be met with the same lack of accountability and professionalism, followed by another hang-up. 

I demand an immediate review and resolution of this claim. I expect a clear and valid explanation for why my dispute has been mishandled and the inappropriate behavior of your staff addressed. This is unacceptable, and I expect a prompt and satisfactory response. If this matter is not resolved properly, I will have no choice but to escalate this issue further.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was one of the customers of Wells Fargo who was denied a XXXX modification. I have not received anything from Wells Fargo. Because I lost my home it would probably be hard for anyone to reach me. Actually, I should have been one of the first people WF reached out to because I fought hard and long to get them to correct my account with excessive fees, etc.

Immediately after my husband died, I found out that Wells Fargo messed up my loan by creating an escrow account claiming I owed money for my taxes which had been paid. Also, when I carefully audited my account I found they had added a bunch of unnecessary fees. Wells Fargo double paid the taxes on my home. I contacted each taxing authority to sort things out and get proof, which I sent to Wells Fargo. Even after Wells Fargo received the proof and each taxing authority REIMBURSED them, WF still did not remove or correct the error on my account.

Later I applied for a HAMP modification which I was MORE than qualified/eligible to receive and was turned down more than nine ( 9 ) times. I worked with the people that were setup to help with modifications, I even paid people to modify my loan and each time I was denied. No one could understand why I wasn't getting approved. My attorney spoke with WF attorneys and WF 's attorney 's didn't understand why I wasn't being approved. Due to my persistence, at one point my account was handled by executive offices and even WF 's employees could not understand why I wasn't being approved. My home ended up in foreclosure several times and I even filed a lawsuit against Well Fargo and all their servicing companies. I wrote to Washington begging for help! After fighting to keep my home for years, I lost it in XXXX  and became XXXX. I was separated from my XXXX  and basically lived on the streets with my XXXX little dogs. By the grace of XXXX my XXXX  was able to stay with some friends of his until he graduated high school and went to college in XXXX XXXX 

I still have all of my documentation where I filed lawsuits against Wells Fargo and if you google me on line, you can find copies of it. I eventually had to give up the fight because I couldn't afford counsel, didn't have the knowledge or expertise to fight against WF 's team of lawyers and lost my home where I didn't have access to computers, printers or anything else needed to fight. The shocking and amazing part of my story is that I was able to help XXXX people to modify their loans and get approved for a XXXX modification... ..but couldn't get mine approved. The people I helped were in a worse situation than I was ... .but, they still got approved.

On XXXX2023 Freedom Mortgage confirmed receipt of the document. They said the process take 45-90 days, so my realtor set a closing date based on that information. We contacted Freedom Mortgage as the date approached, and they said due to a mistake they never forwarded the assumption documents to the correct person. They again said it would be another 45-90 days for the process to be completed. My realtor updated all required documents and set another closing date based on that information. Every time we get close to closing, Freedom Mortgage claims that a document has expired, or they need something updated. Weve had to update the Agreement of Sale 4 times since the process started due to Freedom Mortgage delays. The original closing date was scheduled for XXXX2023. Due to the delays and failure to close on that date, it has cost us {$9200.00}, and every month another {$1400.00} is added to that. We own another home now, and were still paying the mortgage on this property nearly a year after initiating the sale process. The same buyer has been with us the entire time as well, they still want the property and are very motivated for this to come to an end.

I have complained to the HUD and they have been assisting, but Freedom Mortgage keeps delaying. They always need more paperwork, and during the delays other paperwork expires. We finally received a decision from their underwriting team, nearly a year after I first initiated the process with the assumption department their response is as follows : " Unfortunately, they have denied the loan as underwriting believes intended purpose is to use property as an investment property. The current loan is an FHA loan which would require a primary occupant to be within loan type requirements and guidelines. '' This decision seems to be based on nothing, as they have no evidence of the intentions of the buyer. The buyer has moved out of their primary residence, and is living in a basement of one of their other properties, as they expected this to be finished months ago. I'm convinced that they're delaying in the hopes that I try to have a conventional sale, and they can get out of this low interest rate 30 year mortgage. The longer they delay, the more it costs me. The buyer threatened legal action, and underwriting has reopened the file, and now they are claiming that they will need a new application as they can't open applications once they've been denied. This will just cause more and more delay. I need any help I can get to have this issue resolved. Thanks!

Ive attached the signed loan assumption form, the 1st and 4th agreements of sale, and various emails showing the frustration and issues weve had with Freedom Mortgage. The Freedom Mortgage contacts can be found in the emails. Please let me know if you need any further information from me, and I truly appreciate your help with this.

JP Morgan Chase decided that they are no longer accepting XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) services and/or Merchants on their Credit Cards XXXX Further below my complaint is the information provided from their FAQ page.

Consider the situations where a consumer does not have an alternate method i.e. they do not have another credit card and/or can not get XXXX within 30 days for a myriad of reasons or the consumer does not have a debit card/account. These consumers will be forced to pay off their XXXX in full or incur huge fees from the XXXX companies. 

It's understandable why Chase does not want to allow these plans as they are direct competitors to their business but the fact that they have allowed them for years and just woke up to smell the roses is not the Consumers fault. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  What is a XXXX XXXX plan? 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX installment plans provide the ability to break up purchases into smaller payments instead of requiring customers to pay the full amount upon purchase. Some examples of external Buy Now Pay Later providers include : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX etc. 

Why Can't I use my Chase card for these? 

Buy Now Pay Later installment plans are a form of credit. Chase generally does not allow the use of your Chase credit card to pay for other credit products, and beginning XX/XX/year>, payments to external XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX plans will not be supported. 

What should I do? 
If your Chase credit card is a payment method for any reoccurring external Buy Now Pay Later installment plans, please update the payment method with your XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX provider to avoid any missed payments or late fees ( if applicable ). If your method of payment to a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX provider is by a Chase debit card or checking account, it will not be impacted by this change. 

... Etc.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, I have a mortgage account with Chase. I was granted to have my account be deferred with forbearance. I communicated throughout the forbearance weekly, to months with different representatives that called me. During the forbearance, inspectors came to my house, took pictures and made assessments. I did not consent or ask for my home to be inspected. Doing such act from the banks became very stressful to me and my family. I called the bank and told a representative to not send anyone to my house to take pictures and assess. After that demand, inpectors stop coming to my house. I continued to speak with representatives weekly to months about my hardship. During the first week of XX/XX/year>, I spoke with a representative and was told, in order to prevent my home from going to forclosure, a partial payment of {$5400.00} approximately or the full amount {$8300.00} approximately were to be paid before XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, I called in to make a partial payment in the amount of {$5400.00}, however my payment was not being accepted. It was said that a foreclosure became active. I explained what was told for me to do to prevent my account from being a threat to foreclosure. The representative was very nasty, rude and didn't handle my explanation well. I requested to speak to her manager. I was then transferred to the escalations department, in which XXXX took on my call. He stated to me, " ... rest assured my issue will be handled and that his colleague will be written up for being nasty, rude and unprofessional to me. '' This is all happening on XX/XX/year>. I explain the issue to XXXX and it was told that the calls need listened to. I specifically asked him " ... how long will it take to hear the conversation between me and his colleagues because I do not want any fees to occur upon XX/XX/year>. '' It was told to me that since my issue is under investigation, no fees will take place. It was said then that it will take 3-5 business days. XXXX reaches back out to me almost 2 weeks later and stated that nothing was said about partial payments or full payments being said to me in the conversation transcript. I ask if I can hear it, he said due to their policy and regulations, that I can't listen to conversation. He then gave an option to listen to a later date. Which he then said, it will take 3-5 business days. Since XX/XX/year> to late XX/XX/year>, I been getting the run around with different representatives, in different departments. After speaking back with XXXX, a resolution came into play for payment and I was transferred to a representative to make a payment. 

At the time of being transferred, funds of what was needed to pay was not fully available. This is due to my mother not being on the phone to make a payment with me at the time. It was ask, how much I was willing to pay, I said the partial payment of what was told to make, via {$5400.00}. It was accepeted and the representative stated to me that a partial payment can be made with my mother. I stressed and asked the representative numerous times, " are you sure I can make a payment and there will be no problems when making the attempt with my mother. It was clear from the representative that I can make a partial payment and that my mother will need to be authorized by me during the call. 

When calling back to make a payment with my mother, another representative staed that I cant make a payment. Which XXXX then had to listen to the phone conversations. By then, I decided to record converaations, to show proof to all these hearsays that can't be heard on their transcripts. After telling XXXX that I have everything recorded, he then tells me that it was revealed that payment options was told to me the first week of XX/XX/year>. However, he now has to listen to the transcrip of what his colleague stated to me on the phone about granting me and my mother to make partial payment ( which takes 3-5 business days ). After listening to the conversation transcript, XXXX calls me back with news that it was said from his colleague that a partial payment can be made. 

I made a payment of {$7000.00} instead, and continue to pay up to being current with the financial help given from my mother. After payments were made, my account suppose to be current. It magically show fees in XXXX for a forclosure/bankruptcy/attorney cost - disbursement for {$30.00} An attorney/court - disbursement fee for {$900.00} ... and another attorney/court- disbursement fee for {$770.00} Whereas XXXX stated to me that no fees are to be charged ( due to my issue being underview ). He stated to me that his manager XXXX will call me 24-48 hours to resolve the issue of fees that shouldn't be on my account. However, his manager didn't call me. Another manager called instead, stated that the fees can not be taken off. 

This is where my complaint comes in. I have hours of recording to show proof of what was said to me. XXXX even admit that he stated that no fees are to be charged on to my account. However, fees are charged to my account. There was no explanation to why the fees that occurred, cant be credited back. I told the manager, I will get an attorney involved to handle this matter. Which i was told about consumer finance complaint. I am now seeking help to file a complaint against Chase. I am enclosing screen shots to my call log of proof to conversation being made on XX/XX/year> and the proof to charges being made to my account, but yet, it was told that I will not be charged any fees from XXXX in the escalations department

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Sub-issue: Money was taken from your account on the wrong day or for the wrong amount
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2023 I went to the Wells Fargo branch location at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX, NC to deposit my payroll check. I utilized the drive through teller window to deposit my payroll check in the amount of {$870.00} On my deposit slip, I instructed the teller to deposit the full amount of the check into my Savings Account # XXXX, with {$200.00} of the check amount issued to me in cash as a withdrawal. The teller provided me with 10 bills worth {$20.00} each. Later, I received a notification that my check had been returned as unpaid due to a tear at the bottom of the check where the account and routing numbers are located. Due to this returned check, my account was debited {$870.00}. However, my account should have only been debited that entire amount if I had actually withdrawn the entire amount of the check in cash. I did not. My balance should have been brought down to {$340.00} since my account was at {$530.00} at the time of the deposit and I only withdrew {$200.00} of the returned check amount in cash. Instead, I have been told that my account has a negative balance because Wells Fargo claims that they issued me the entire check amount of {$870.00} as a cash withdrawal. 

Wells Fargo has performed an initial investigation of this matter under claim number XXXX and determined that they do not owe me any money because I received a new check from my employer for the returned check amount. However, Wells Fargo has incorrectly claimed that I withdrew the full check amount in cash on that day and now claims that I owe them that amount. That is false. I only withdrew {$200.00} of the {$870.00} check and attempted to deposit the remainder. Wells Fargo has claimed that there is no video footage of this matter and that I withdrew the entire amount of the check in cash. I respectfully do not believe that to be the case. I request that this matter be reviewed. You will find that the teller never handed me {$870.00}. She only provided me with {$200.00}. I am simply asking for my account to be properly debited for the actual withdrawal that I made of {$200.00} which would bring my account balance to {$340.00}, which accurately represents the {$200.00} debit from the original amount of {$540.00}. The deposit slip presented to the teller that day confirmed that the full check was deposited to the bank, except for {$200.00} that was provided to me as a cash withdrawal. Thank you for looking into this matter.
