Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
VOLATIONS Federal Reserve Act Section 16. Note Issues 1. Issuance of Federal Reserve notes ; nature of obligation ; where redeemable Federal reserve notes, to be issued at the discretion of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System for the purpose of making advances to Federal reserve banks through the Federal reserve agents as hereinafter set forth and for no other purpose, are hereby authorized. The said notes shall be obligations of the United States and shall be receivable by all national and member banks and Federal reserve banks and for all taxes, customs, and other public dues. They shall be redeemed in lawful money on demand at the Treasury Department of the United States, in the city of Washington , District of Columbia, or at any Federal Reserve bank.

[ 12 USC 411. As amended by act of XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ). For redemption of Federal reserve notes whose bank of issue can not be identified, see act of XX/XX/XXXX. ] 2. Application for notes by Federal Reserve banks Any Federal Reserve bank may make application to the local Federal Reserve agent for such amount of the Federal Reserve notes hereinbefore provided for as it may require. Such application shall be accompanied with a tender to the local Federal Reserve agent of collateral in amount equal to the sum of the Federal Reserve notes thus applied for and issued pursuant to such application. The collateral security thus offered shall be notes, drafts, bills of exchange, or acceptances acquired under section XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX of this Act, or bills of exchange endorsed by a member bank of any Federal Reserve district and purchased under the provisions of section 14 of this Act, or bankers ' acceptances purchased under the provisions of said section 14, or gold certificates, or Special Drawing Right certificates, or any obligations which are direct obligations of, or are fully guaranteed as to principal and interest by, the United States or any agency thereof, or assets that Federal Reserve banks may purchase or hold under section 14 of this Act or any other asset of a Federal reserve bank. In no event shall such collateral security be less than the amount of Federal Reserve notes applied for. The Federal Reserve agent shall each day notify the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of all issues and withdrawals of Federal Reserve notes to and by the Federal Reserve bank to which he is accredited. The said Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System may at any time call upon a Federal Reserve bank for additional security to protect the Federal Reserve notes issued to it. Collateral shall not be required for Federal Reserve notes which are held in the vaults of, or are otherwise held by or on behalf of, Federal Reserve banks.
Company public response: None
Company: Smith Debnam Narron Drake Saintsing & Myers LLP

egarding this review. Under 12 CFR 1026.11, Am
ex is required to refund any part of the remaining credit balance within 7 business days from receipt of a written request from the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase closed my debit card while I traveling overseas, blocking dozens of transactions without any legitimate claim. Chase failed to record my new address in the United States, refused to record my new phone number, and when I arrived in the United States, Chase blocked transactions leaving me without any access to my funds. 

When I went to the Chase branch at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2023, despite having my passport, drivers license, and debit card, Chase refused to provide me with access to cash, and also refused to close my account and issue me a cashier 's check for the balance.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
REFERRAL # XXXX RE : Denial of Equity ; Demand for Consideration To whom it shall concern, On or around XX/XX/XXXX I tendered a security, in acceptance to the offer proposed in prospectus, for fair exchange of American Express Company products. I received a response in the mail stating that my application was denied because of a poor score, however, according to your prospectus, filed pursuant to Rule 424 ( b ) ( 5 ) with the SEC, in the annex section of that document, on pg. XXXX, the first sentence of the passage states, scores are based on independent, third-party information, the accuracy of which we can not verify. 

What other factors were used in denying me when I TENDERED A SECURITY that your company will turn into a receivable to receive payment for. 

It is unfair and deceptive to rely on information that you can not verify to determine my eligibility for American Express products, this could be construed as violations of UDAAP under federal law. To my knowledge, credit scores are used to determine the potential risks of prospective consumers, I have read and understood the concerns outlined in you guys prospectus in regards to risk and you can rest assured that my account will never be delinquent, there will never be a period of inactivity or dormancy with my charges and my account will be paid on time each and every month because I will be satisfying my obligation by tendering payment with the series of notes that American Express will issue out on the distribution date as described in your Prospectus. 

Furthermore, the taking of my application, with my personal identifiable information on its face, i.e. the social security number, and the transferring thereof to a depositor where it was pooled together with other receivables ( eligible investment ) and sold/transferred to a securitization special purpose entity ( trust ) for proceeds which is considered unjust enrichment and securities fraud on your companys behalf because I received no benefit. In addition, because you accepted my security you were supposed to be acting as POA in a fiduciary capacity for the benefit and protection of the investor. 

Fair exchange has never been robbery, quid pro quo, this was a barter transaction that took place with your company for equal value and consideration neither of which were received by me. Your company is in violation of the securities laws you agreed to follow and if I have to contact the I.R.S to inform them that I bartered to you a security and you decided not to live up to your end of the bargain by bartering back with me, I will have no choice but to notify them, which could have a damaging effect on the American Express Brand if further action is necessary. Let it be known and allow me to reiterate that the American Express Company owes me valuable consideration ( in the form of an American Express open-end Platinum credit card or its equivalent ) for the exchange of my security, which constituted a bartering transaction, that of which will be filed on a 1099B with the I.R.S if you continue to refuse to barter with me. Ill let the I.R.S handle it. There may have been some sort of misunderstanding with the terms of the contract, but let me reassure you that I intend for this arrangement to be mutually beneficial to all parties involved, including myself. However, as it stands right now, I have been held without equity and American Express Company is in violation of its bank charter, federal securities laws, and their agreements on file with the SEC because pursuant to your prospectus you told the SEC you would not trade securities on the secondary market, or maybe Im misinterpreting what was stated. Anyway, you may have many concerns none of which shall arise from doing business with me and many of which would result from your failure to compensate me for my investment into your company as a silent investor. IN THE EVENT THAT YOU DECIDE NOT TO COMPLY I WILL BE FORCED TO FILE A COMPLAINT WITH THE OCC, THE SEC, THE CFPB AND THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD, SEPARATELY FOR YOUR WILLFUL NONCOMPLIANCE AND BREACH OF CONTRACT. YOU HAVE 15 DAYS AFTER THE RECEIPT OF THIS NOTICE TO RESPOND WITH A DECISION REGARDING THIS MATTER. 

Please tell me what are the factors that the underwriting team used to decide the application reasoning for denial. 

I gave you my social security number which gave you access to my trust. Several laws have been violated, such as 15 us code 1666b and the violation of the security exchange act of 1934. 


In accordance with their Trust Indenture Agreement, Section 7.08.As the Investor, Equitable Account Owner and Note Holder, I have an absolute right to receive payment of the principal of, and interest on, my Notes when due, and to institute suit to enforce any such payment. The Trustee and Paying Agent for all notes held by Noteholders pursuant to their Prospectus and Trust Indenture Agreement. In the same Trust Indenture Agreement under " GRANTING CLAUSE '', The Security Interest in the Collateral is granted to secure the Notes ( and the related obligations under this Indenture ), except as otherwise expressly provided in this Indenture or in the Indenture Supplement which establishes any Series, Class or Tranche of Notes, and to secure ( i ) the payment of all amounts due on such Notes ( and, to the extent so specified, the obligations under any applicable Derivative Agreements ) in accordance with their terms, ( ii ) the payment of all other sums payable by the Issuer under this Indenture or any Indenture Supplement relating to the Notes and ( iii ) compliance by the Issuer with the provisions of this Indenture or any Indenture Supplement. American Express National Bank FSB, has a Fiduciary Obligation to make payment of all sums due on the note. 

Each of the name Trustees have a Fiduciary obligation to make sure I do not suffer any harm from this account, but have all failed to perform on my behalf. Additionally, in their " Prospectus '' under " Consumer Financial Products Regulation '' - The relationship of the consumer and the provider of consumer credit is extensively regulated by federal and state consumer protection laws. With respect to credit accounts issued by AENB, the most significant federal laws include the federal Truth in Lending, Equal Credit Opportunity, Fair Credit Reporting and Fair Debt Collection Practices Acts. In addition, account holders are entitled under these laws to have PAYMENTS and CREDITS applied to the revolving credit account PROMPTLY and to request prompt resolution of billing errors. I have filed billing error dispute with said company for months and they have refused to apply the credits to my account " PROMPTLY '' as stated in their Prospectus agreement with the SEC. this is a violation of their " Prospectus Agreement and breach of their Trust Indenture Agreement '' filed with the SEC and they should be held accountable for their Gross Negligence.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue with the loan closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been a victim of an illegal predatory loan and fraud by XXXX XXXX and Village Capital and Investment LLC. The basis for fraud are on the grounds of altering documentation to mislead the VA and myself to the benefit of the loan, steal equity, predatory lending in order to gain possession of my home for resale, and because they violated numerous regulations under REG E, RESPA, TILA, FHA, and Americans with Disabilities laws. 

On XX/XX/2023 I was contacted by phone from XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX about refinancing my home. She claimed that I had already been approved for a cash out refinance of my home and guaranteed a lower interest rate, pay off my debts saving me a substantial amount of money each month. She told me to cancel the contract I had already signed with another lender and claimed they would tell me what I wanted to hear and then at closing they would increase my interest rates, I would have a higher payment, and end up paying dramatically more over the life time of the loan. She said by this loan not only would I save money each month, I would have a higher credit score by my debts being paid off and can refinance again in XXXX  months at an even lower rate. She told me I needed to act now to lock in my interest rates before they were raised again by the federal reserve. She told me I needed to have a new appraisal done on my home and I would be reimbursed at closing for it.

The initial terms she stated I would be getting is over XXXX at closing, a refund of my escrow, a 4.75 % interest rate, paying off my current mortgage at XXXX, and eliminating around XXXX in debt and my monthly payment would only increase by a couple XXXX dollars. I explained to her that the payoffs on my credit report were not correct because of Identity Theft and fraud charges on my accounts and they were in the process of getting the new account numbers and balances transferred over and correct balances after unauthorized charges have been removed. She also said closing would take place by XXXX XXXX  as I was scheduled to go out of town to take care of my daughter  after a very XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX also at the time told me I would not have a mortgage payment for XXXX months and I didnt have to make an payments on my cards or vehicle for the month of XXXX because they were getting paid off. 
My home was appraised at XXXX. Initially I was only going to be financing XXXX. Well XXXX raised the amount to XXXX saying I requested it. Well raising the amount raised the interest rate, I was getting less money at closing, they were paying less of my debts because they didnt even bother getting the payoffs and went by my credit report which they knew was not correct, and closing costs went from XXXX to XXXX so this so called request for more money resulted in me financing more and getting back even less. At the time, I was unaware of any of this because XXXX XXXX continued misleading me and making it look like this loan was going to benefit me. The closing didnt happen by XXXX  XXXX  and I was getting phone calls from creditors wanting payments and reports made to the credit bureaus for payments being late. I was told they would submit credit supplements and the creditors knew they were getting paid off because she contacted them. That was a lie because she didnt even know who serviced my accounts and that my vehicle loan went from XXXX XXXX to XXXX despite the fact I kept telling her the information she refused to listen. 
On closing day, a notary was sent to my home. I am a victim of XXXX XXXX  and rated XXXX  with XXXX for XXXX. She sent a male notary to my home where I was alone despite me requesting that a female notary from the sales office for my neighborhood do the closing. The closing attorney was not present and was not even aware of the closing and the broker or lender were not present in person or by phone at closing. I was having XXXX  and in a panicked state due to my XXXX and fear of being XXXX because of this male in my home and me alone. I was only given the signature pages of documents and told everything was as discussed with my lender and rushed through signing. After the last document was signed I was given copies. I immediately looked through them and absolutely nothing was as discussed or like the closing disclosures I had previously been given. The amounts for the debts were still incorrect and the same as they were the whole time and me telling her they were incorrect. I called XXXX and immediately told her that I didnt agree with the loan and that she lied and misled me. She said she was there to help me and she would get the amounts changed to wait until the checks arrived from disbursement. She again intentionally lied and misled me because she knew the checks would not arrive in time for me to rescend the loan and there was nothing I could do then. I got the checks and they were still wrong and third party payments in which my creditors would not accept and she refused to listen. She also admitted that they included my escrow refund in the documents as part of what I was getting cash in hand in order to get VA approval by making it look like I was benefitting from the refinance. Instead I was placed in financial detriment. None of my debts were paid off, my accounts closed because the disbursement company cancelled payments and said payments were unauthorized, fees were added, my credit was ruined, I had a XXXX mortgage payment, only received XXXX dollars at closing which all went to paying on debts they said they would pay and didnt even include, and a loan that did not benefit me at all and they knew I could not pay. This loan was fraud, predatory lending, and not extended in good faith and was designed to steal my equity and take my home. I have documentation in the form of emails and texts messages proving how I was lied to and mislead the whole time by XXXX XXXX and then her manager XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX. Then the loan was sold to Village Capital and Investments who are already trying to foreclose and force me into a loss mitigation agreement that is not helping me at all because it increases my payments even more. I can not even refinance because of the debt they didnt pay off and with my now ruined credit. I can not afford the retainer for a corporate attorney to take them to court to stop foreclosure and sue for fraud and damages. This loan was nothing but a scheme to steal my equity and my home and receive even more money from VA  backing and stop XXXX XXXX XXXX and Village Capital and Investment LLC from doing this to anymore veterans and taking their homes and leaving them in financial ruin for profit. Now neither company will respond to me at all, they will not respond to my inquiry on why nothing is being done considering I have it in writing from XXXX  saying my debts would be paid off no matter what. I also have it on writing from XXXX XXXX that she intentionally lied on documentions and disclosures by including my escrow refund in cash in hand at closing to make it look like I was receiving more cash in hand than I actually was and the escrow refund was not included in the breakdown. On top of that, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX along with XXXX XXXX  has stopped payment on third party checks they sent to my creditors knowing that third party payments are not authorized by my creditors resulting in my accounts being closed for unauthorized third party payments further damaging my credit and severely hurting my financial situation as I now have no access to credit cards thanks to my accounts being closed. Village Capital refuses to do anything but continue demanding a payment I can not make and threatening foreclosure. They refuse to do any kind of modification to the loan to pay off the debts in full that I was told and VA was told would be paid off which was the basis used to get my loan approved. A duty was had to verify my payoffs and debts since they were made aware that my credit report was not accurate and that was not done. The lender also took on a fiduciary relationship when it advised me on financial matters and sent in payments to my creditors and then failed to have my best interest at hand and instead financially ruined me and destroyed my credit. They refused to work with me to find a resolution that benefits me and only continues to try and force me into a payment plan that increases my payment even more than the one I already can't afford. I have asked for proof that the fees charged were valid, I have received no response and this has been going on since XX/XX/XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Let me first say Target has poor customer service. I got hung up on by a supervisor and lied to by a specialist. I will No longer give them my money! 

The company is going against my consumer rights. 
Violating US codes 1681a 2 ). ( i ), US code 1666b ( a ), US code 1681e ( b ).

According to US Code 1681a 2 ). ( I ) report containing information solely as a transaction or experience between the Consumer and the Person making the report. My experience is the relationship between the transaction and the creditor or the person of the corporation that extends the line of credit that is used at a particular time of the account. Which is the consumer, which is me and the person making the report. 

Moreover, US Code 1666b ( a ) states A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. 

Stated by the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) Instruction for forms 1099-A and 1099-C. A 1099-C must be filled regardless of whether the debtor is required to report the debt as income. Income does not get reported on your consumer report. Therefore, a consumer of a charge-off being reported on your consumer report is illegal because it is ordinary income. If a charge off is being reported on your consumer report it is not accurate and reasons to believe the whole account is fraudulent according to the IRS from instruction form 1099-A and 1099C. 

Lastly, US Code 1681e ( b ) explains, Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 
This statement explains doing so will presume a 1099-C, that must be filled according to the IRS as mentioned above. The status of a charge-off is an inaccurate account and it must be deleted.

Under 15 US Code 1681b ( 2 ) I am exercising my right and I demand these inaccurate accounts be deleted Immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I called JP Morgan Chase to close my XXXX XXXX credit card. I made it clear that I was closing my card and wanted to make a final payment. I even asked if there were any recurring charges coming up for subscriptions. The specialist told me there were no recurring charges and what my balance was which I promptly paid.

Two weeks ago I got a notification that my credit score has changed. I contact XXXX, they said a pending charge hit the day after I closed the account. 

So I am immediately paid everything over the phone and placed a dispute for the credit reporting because they did not send me any information about any additional charges or balances after I closed the account. Not a single statement, phone call, letter, email, or text. I monitor my account balances with a financial program and the balance had shown XXXX since XXXX. 

After they pulled the phone call, a supervisor called me to tell me that she listened to the entire call. She confirmed it was my intent to close my card, that I asked about recurring charges, and that my history showed I have never been late with any payments. She also confirmed that they did not send me any notifications. 

But she said that I did not specifically ask if there were pending charges and that even though the specialist could see that on her screen and did not inform me of that, that is not a bank error that is my fault. Unbelievable! 

I asked if I could escalate this to a manager and she told me she was a supervisor and that there was nothing I could do. 

This is an unfair trade practice and just plain bad business. They should correct the credit reporting due to their negligence and egregious behavior. 

Hopefully you have the ability to have those phone calls pulled to see how ridiculous this is. 

Thank you!

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: A week ago on XX/XX/XXXX, I was scammed by a user on the social media site XXXX. After unsuccessfully attempting to buy concert tickets the user claimed they were going to refund me the amount. After waiting for my refund and receiving nothing on XX/XX/XXXX the user told me I needed to deposit a cashier 's check for {$2500.00} into my bank account from their cousin so that they could pay me. I was to deposit the check and transfer the rest of the money to them. I voiced my discomfort with the transaction and the user began pressuring me by claiming that the money was for their rent and to feed their kids. After depositing I forwarded them the money on XX/XX/XXXX and told them I would not help them again. A few hours later the user sent me a message that a XXXX check was " accidentally '' sent to me by their cousin and that I would need to send them that money. I once again retaliated saying I was not comfortable and that they needed to reverse the charge and send the money elsewhere. The user pressured me again saying that their car had broken down and had no food and needed the money. They texted and called my phone repeatedly. Due to the pressure of the constant texts and calls I sent them the money again in hopes that they'd leave me alone. Late on XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email correspondence from Wells Fargo that the checks bounced due to being fraudulent and that the money from the checks was charged back to my account. I only had {$200.00} in the account at the time so my account ended up negative {$2700.00}. Upon seeing this email I blocked the user. When I tried to call Wells Fargo to file a claim on XX/XX/XXXX I was notified that their debit fraud office was closed for the weekend, even though their business credit fraud office was open. I then began receiving threatening calls and texts from the user 's " cousin. '' They accused me of stealing their money, threatened to track me down personally, and harassed me repeatedly over the course of the weekend. I told them I was reporting them for fraud and they blocked me on everything. After filing my claim with Wells Fargo on XX/XX/XXXX, I was told it would take XXXX business days to resolve. After 2 days I called to receive an update on my fraud claim and they notified me that it had been denied but was still being investigated. The second check that they had me deposit then bounced and was charged to my account, leaving me negative {$5700.00}. They told me that although I informed them that I was being threatened and harassed that they are not liable for the scam and that I would have to pay that money back to Wells Fargo. I informed them that I am living paycheck to paycheck and can not afford to pay that money back and they have reiterated that they are not liable and I will be sent to collections.

I believe that Wells Fargo ( Visa-Signature Card ) is a collaborator in allowing fraud to be perpetrated on client Credit Card Accounts. She said that she could not reverse the reservation once made. ( red flag-two ) I asked to speak with her supervisor. I was informed that there was no one to speak to. '' I filed a complaint a couple of days later with Wells Fargo and this has been going back and forth for several months now. I recently received a communication from Wells Fargo Bank stating " After further review of your dispute claim for the XXXX charge on XX/XX/2023, from XXXX, we confirm that it was handled appropriately '' WHAT? This is clearly a " bait and switch '' tactic, unscrupulous, illegal and fraudulent in my opinion. I am disgusted by the actions taken by this institution!

On XX/XX/XXXX, Nissan XXXX  XXXX dealership paid off the car I had leased from them in full by mistake so my Nissan Motor Acceptance Corporation " NMAC " car lease account was closed ... no futher payments could be made. 

2. Dealership went to arbitration to correct it and have my NMAC lease account reopened. 

3. I filled a complaint against the dealership with NCDOJ and XXXX but the dealership did not respond to either of them. 

4. Dealership executive manager accepted their error in XX/XX/XXXX and agreed : - to make my car payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX when NMAC reopens my lease account - to an additional refund of {$680.00} 5. No contacts were made by NMAC or the dealership with me ... no bills, explaination, notifications about a closed ornew account, warnings, repossession notice, etc.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX RE : Complaint Regarding Collection Activity by CREDIT CONTROL CORP Dear CFPB, I am writing to file a complaint against CREDIT CONTROL CORP for violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and my rights as a consumer.

1. Failure to Provide Validation Information I received a communication from CREDIT CONTROL CORP stating that I owe a debt of XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX However, the collection agency failed to provide me with the required validation information as outlined in 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), which includes the amount of the debt, the name of the creditor, and a statement of my rights to dispute the debt. This omission violates my right to ensure the accuracy of the debt before it is reported to credit reporting agencies.

2. Lack of Opportunity to Dispute the Debt Furthermore, the collection agency has not provided me with a clear and straightforward method to dispute the debt, in violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ). This lack of access to the dispute process hinders my ability to challenge the validity of the debt.

3. False, Misleading, and Deceptive Practices The collection agency 's actions constitute a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681-s-2 ( 7 ) ( A ) by using false, misleading, and deceptive means to collect the debt. Their failure to provide validation information and opportunity to dispute creates an environment of pressure and confusion, which is unfair and unlawful. 

4. Furnishing Information to Credit Reporting Agencies Without Proper Disclosure Additionally, the collection agency 's attempt to report the debt to credit reporting agencies without providing the necessary disclosures outlined in 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) is a violation of my rights. This action could negatively impact my credit score without ensuring the legitimacy of the debt.

5. Request for Resolution Therefore, I am requesting the CFPB to inves
tigate these violations and take appropriate action against CREDIT CONTROL CORP This includes : Instructing the collection agency to cease all collection activities until they comply with the FDCPA.

Requiring the collection agency to provide me with the missing validation information and a clear process to dispute the debt.

Preventing the collection agency from reporting the debt to credit bureaus until its accuracy is verified.

Furthermore, I request the following documentation from the collection agency : Debt validation document as outlined in 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ).

Proof of their agreement to purchase the debt from the original creditor.

Verification of their license and bond status.

I have attached copies of all relevant documents, including the communication from the collection agency.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of this complaint. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX Case Number : XXXX Member Case Number : XXXX I am writing to dispute charges and request refunds for both XXXX and XXXX XXXXXXXX due to XXXX XXXX XXXX mismanagement. The disputed charge on my Chase Sapphire XXXX credit card occurred on XX/XX/year> for round-trip flights from XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, totaling {$420.00}. The booking order ID is XXXX, and the travelers were myself and a companion. The flights included XXXX on XX/XX/year> from XXXX to XXXX, XXXX on XX/XX/year> from XXXX to XXXX, XXXX on XX/XX/year> from XXXX to XXXX, and XXXX on XX/XX/year> from XXXX to XXXX. 

Flight number one was briefly delayed but otherwise uneventful. Flight number two experienced a significant delay of over two hours due to air conditioning issues, with the pilot personally explaining the situation to irate passengers. While many passengers received credits after contacting XXXX, my companion and I refrained from raising concerns and eventually boarded, arriving in XXXX XXXX hours later than expected. 

Flight number three was the best of the bunch, with only a brief delay. My companion received seat assignments for both flights XXXX and XXXX, but I received a ticket without a seat assignment for flight four. The worst travel experience occurred on flight four. Upon arrival in XXXX from flight three, we were notified of a two-hour delay, changing the departure time from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX. We waited at the gate for hours without a gate agent present to address seat assignment issues. One hour before departure, the flight disappeared from the gate display, causing confusion among passengers. 

Flight attendants confirmed the gate was correct but could not assist with seat assignments. When gate agents finally arrived, they began boarding immediately, leaving no time to address the missing seat assignments. After all ticketed passengers boarded, the gate agent denied boarding to me and other remaining passengers, claiming the last passenger followed unknown instructions. I called my companion, who reported unoccupied seats on the plane and a flight attendant 's attempt to assist. The gate agent falsely accused me of " cussing out '' the agent, then admitted I was just upset. My companion disembarked to support me, and a physical altercation occurred between the gate agent and another passenger. XXXX denied boarding to me and other passengers despite valid tickets, forcing us to book an alternative XXXX flight for {$750.00} to return home, nearly double the XXXX itinerary cost. 

We shared this experience with XXXX support on XX/XX/year>, and they offered a grossly insufficient {$15.00} refund. We then disputed the charge with Chase, requesting a refund for {$100.00}, representing one-quarter of the XXXX itinerary. Chase initially refunded the amount on XX/XX/year> but later denied the dispute and re-applied the amount on XX/XX/year>, citing XXXX 's false documentation of me as a " XXXX '' for flight four. 

Due to XXXX XXXX ' mismanagement, significant delays, and fraudulent documentation of events, we were forced to book a last-minute XXXX flight to return home. I am requesting refunds for both the XXXX flight segment and the XXXX flight. The XXXX refund should cover {$100.00}, representing one-quarter of the original itinerary cost, and the XXXX refund should cover the full {$750.00} incurred due to XXXX failure to honor the ticket and provide acceptable customer service. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX handling of the situation was unacceptable, and their records inaccurately depict the events. I seek full refunds for both the denied XXXX flight segment and the XXXX flight that was necessary due to XXXX XXXX  mismanagement and misrepresentation. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: None

Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX after banking hours, we learned that our company Wells Fargo accounts had been compromised and fraudulent charges had hit the account. We attempted to resolve this through online banking support with no success and myself and the other account owner ( my wife, XXXX XXXX XXXX went into the branch to have them resolve for us. 

While sitting with our banker in the branch, she could see numerous charges coming through from in-person bank withdrawals to e-transfers to other ATM withdrawals and XXXX large wire transfer occurring all over the country. At the time these were occurring, we were sitting face-to-face with the banker in XXXX, NC. The banker immediately filed fraud claims for us on all deposits but we were advised that we " needed to let the charges settle to the account before she could complete the claim process ''. The largest of these charges was a {$23000.00} wire transfer which Wells Fargo attempted to put a stop on. The stop did not work, and they filed a fraud claim. We were later informed that the amount listed on the fraud claim was {$0.00} and therefore the claims department had nothing to take action on. The claim was later revised and resubmitted by the branch, but we were told that they could not do anything further on this. 

We did receive credits for some of the fraudulent activity. Now, XXXX of those credits has been reversed without notice or without informing us of any findings on the side of Wells Fargo. We never received any credit for the {$23000.00} wire transfer. 

At the onset of these issues, we reached out to the FBI who initially followed up and were able to interview some of the branches where this fraudulent activity took place. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, having received no further updates from our local Wells Fargo branch, we escalated this matter to the XXXX XXXX  President ( Small Business & Retail ) - XXXX XXXX. While he has provided a return phone call to every email sent, we have only been told that " they are looking into how to fix this ''. 

Further, on XX/XX/24 XXXX of the previously credited fraudulent transfers ( Amount of {$4800.00} ) was reversed out of XXXX of the accounts. No information was provided as to the reason, and since it has been well established that all of the withdrawals in question took place around the country while the account owners were sitting in the branch office and it is impossible to have been a result of our own actions, we find no reason these charges should have been reversed. 

We were initially told that the institution had XXXX to issue provisional credits for any fraudulent activity. At 62 days past, we still have not received any credit for the wire transfer of {$23000.00}. We were additionally told that once a provisional credit is issued, the bank has 45 days to investigate further and make a final ruling. The provisional credit that was pulled was past the 45 day window.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Chase Bank ( JP Morgan Chase & Co ) had a " Chase Offer '' for the XXXX XXXX credit card that I have. The offer was for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ; 10 % cash back, up to {$100.00} back. They require customers to opt in the the offer, which I did, and then complete a purchase on or before XX/XX/2024. I had already booked a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX stay before the offer became available, so when I was in the lobby of the hotel prior to checking in on XX/XX/2024, I opened the Chase banking application on my phone and verified that the offer was through the XXXX XXXX credit card and not my other Chase credit cards so I would get the {$100.00} cash back offer. I had my girlfriend look at the application with me to verify I was looking at the right credit card account. 

Our check out date for the hotel was XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX XXXX and XXXX initiated the charge to the credit card on XX/XX/XXXX, the last day of the Chase offers. My charges were over {$1000.00}, so that qualified me for the entire {$100.00} cash back. In the days following, the XXXX XXXX took longer to settle than any credit card charge I've previously had with Chase. The official charge date did finally settle and correctly listed it as XX/XX/XXXX. By XX/XX/XXXX, I still had not received the promotional cash back credit, so I called Chase Bank customer service. The employee I spoke with said he saw the promotion I was speaking of, but the transaction was still within the 14 business days needed to process the cash back. I saw the employee was correct as it had only been 10 business days since the charge. The employee asked me to call back if I still didn't receive the cash back by Friday XX/XX/XXXX. 

By XX/XX/XXXX I still had not received the promotional cash back for {$100.00}. I called Chase customer service back on XX/XX/2024. I asked them to give me the {$100.00} credit that was due to me. The woman I spoke to could not find the promotional offer I was referencing, and now the offer was no longer visible in my Chase Offer " wallet, '' where it should list any offer I opted in to, even if they were not used or expired. She said she would escalate the incident so I could receive my promotional credit. Later in XXXX I received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, stating I didn't notice qualify for a promotion that earns me credit card points for booking multiple travel charges ; this offer had NOTHING to do with the XX/XX/XXXX offer I was referencing on my 2 prior calls to Chase Customer service.

I asked again for the {$100.00} credit that was due to me, and the employee refused to give it I to me. Today, XX/XX/2024, I received an email stating I had a letter that was once again denying me the {$100.00} promotional cash back credit.

Please investigate and get me my money.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a notice exhibit 1 in uploads, from Caine & Weiner dated XX/XX/year> claim they are a debt furnisher, this letter didn't advise me that I could dispute or how to dispute and it was very vague. Within ten ( 10 ) days of the date of their letter the debt collector updated this negative item to all three consumer reporting agencies. This update took place on XX/XX/year> and it was done without my written or verbal consent. Their initial letter didn't give notice that I could dispute their collection, nor did it provide the option to opt out of their communication and furnishing. 

Caine & Weiner violated my rights and the laws of the FDCPA, first by NOT obtaining written permission to furnish information pursuant to 15 USC 1681 ( b ) ( 2 ). The second violation was pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1692g, as they did NOT send me the required written communication within five ( 5 ) days of the original letter furnishing the five ( 5 ) required information below : ( 1 ) the amount of the debt. ( 2 ) the name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed. ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. ( 4 ) a statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the thirty-day period that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and ( 5 ) a statement that, upon the consumers written request within the thirty-day period, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. 

After an alert from my XXXX monitoring account that this was updated to my consumer report, I sent a cease-and-desist letter ( uploaded copy ), as well as a validation of debt letter ( uploaded copy ) to Caine & Weiner dated XX/XX/year> with USPS tracking number XXXX XXXX My letter addressed the violations above and it demanded they remove this item from my consumer report as well provide. I have now received another notice from then dated XX/XX/year> ( exhibit 2 in uploads ) stating that my account with XXXX insurance has been listed with their company for collections. This second notice from Caine & Weiner still doesn't meet the five mandatory points listed above pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1692g ; nor did the most recent notice provide tall of the information I requested in my validation of debt letter. This isn't acceptable as they clearly have already violated the FDCPA regulations and have now harmed my character and any chances of me obtaining credit for personal improvement in my financial wellbeing.
Company public response: None

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
An account was sold from one back to another. 

The original on-line payment method was no longer accepted by the new bank. The new bank did not contact us regarding the change or provide information as to how to pay balances. We did not receive a monthly statements from the bank regarding the new account. 

After a couple months, we were alerted of suspicious activity by a credit monitoring company. 

We made multiple attempts to resolve the issue at local bank branches. We were told the account did not exist. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I located the account and called the bank. I was again told the account can not be located by the bank representative. After some conversation, the representative located the account.

The history on the account only reflected late fees and interest. The bank could not locate a charge associated with the interest and late fee. I asked for all late fees and interest be removed that accrued after the last payment.

The bank removed two late payments, and said they would send a notification of error to the credit score companies. 

I was called on XX/XX/XXXX and was told executive office had opened an investigation and I would be called back when the investigation had been concluded. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called the bank because I had not heard anything from the bank. After an hour on the phone, and speaking to five different representatives. I was told the the investigation was completed. The result of the bank investigation was mailed to me on XX/XX/XXXX. The person who conducted the investigations was in the office but was not prepared to discuss the findings. 

I was told the summary of the investigation did not address why the the local bank branches were unable to locate the account, nor why the bank had no records of successfully contacting us regarding the bank purchasing the account. 

In summery, a bank purchased a credit card account from another bank. They claimed to have sent a letter, but we never received the letter. The bank stopped accepting on-line payment for the account. We discovered the problem with help from a third party. The bank could not locate the account on our attempts to pay the debt. When the bank finally located the account, their response was to only provide the day this bank purchased the account and when they mailed a letter. 

It is my opinion this bank is collecting late fees of {$40.00} a month, by blocking the customers ability to continue their on-line payments. This bank is asking for over {$200.00} from us, because they failed to contact me, by mail or phone, and they denied our requests to pay the balance at a bank branch. I believe the bank 's actions are intentional. If they did this to half of the customers who had accounts purchased from the first bank, the new bank is making XXXX XXXX XXXX in late fees alone.

The company did not notify me of the change in offer status before the end of my billing cycle, triggering a penalty APR and interest charge. The company claims theyre not obligated to inform customers, which I find surprising as a loyal XXXX customer with XXXX of their credit/lending products. However, they DID notify me when the intro APR term ended on a previous card with an identical offer, so I reasonably expected the same communication. I would have paid the entire balance and avoided the interest charges if I had been notified. Given this additional context of historical precedent, the company 's failure to notify appears opportunistic and malicious. I contacted a support agent via the online chat, who denied my interest waiver request. I then worked with a subsequent agent to close all of my credit cards, XXXX  checking, and XXXX  Line of Credit. This agent suggested I reconnect with a support agent to find an alternative solution " based on my account status and membership. '' So, I did. It turns out that the second agent grossly overestimated American Expresss loyalty because subsequent agents could not have cared less about my membership history. No one attempted an alternative solution, and every agent I spoke with tried to end the chat quickly. This isnt the level of customer service I expected when opening XXXX platinum credit card accounts. I expect the intro offer to be reinstated and the interest charge refunded.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: A charge off account is showing on my report & the creditor told me that I can not get a copy of the 1099-C document because they did not officially charge off the debt and they didn't take a write off which is a violation because it says on my credit report that it is charged off which equates to false reporting & not reporting 100 % accurately. FCRA violations refers to a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is a federal law that regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer credit information. Federal law requires that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to ensure 100 % accuracy of the information contained in their credit reports. If a consumer suffers damages as a result of a FCRA violation they may be entitled to bring a private lawsuit against the CRA and recover actual damages, statutory damages, and attorney 's fees. These accounts listed on my letter are not 100 % correct and I demand them to be investigated completely.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, I tried to meet a lady I came across on a social media platform in person. I was deceived into thinking I was about to have a legitimate date with her. Because our shared nationality as XXXX and previous interactions created an illusion of trust, I believed her and satisfied her demand. I took photos of the purchased gift cards and sent them to her. Little did I know it was a criminal theme to defraud me. Shortly, a XXXXXXXX XXXX called me and claimed he was responsible for the lady 's safety and demanded an additional {$2200.00}. This time, I refused to give this amount of money. Then he started to make threats of physical harm and abduction to coerce me to comply with his demand. He claimed that he possessed my personal information and was able to locate me. I believed his threats were credible and feared for my safety. As a result, I was forced to transfer the {$2200.00} in the form of XXXX gift cards and XXXX transfers. When he demanded even more, I realized it was beyond my financial capacity to comply any further, and I decided to cut off the contact and ignore any further threats or harassment either through calls or text messages. In sum, the entire event caused me to lose {$3200.00}. All transactions were conducted through Chase Bank, and the bank authorized my transfers. Later, I filed written complaints with Chase Bank. Chase Bank declined to compensate me for my financial loss.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
From : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NC XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Office for Complaints P. O. Box 27170 Washington , DC 20038 XX/XX/XXXX RE : Consumer Complaint : Predatory Personal Loan - Wells Fargo ( WF ) Account Number XXXX - Paid in Full XX/XX/XXXX Incurred XX/XX/XXXX, Credit Card Consolidation : Wells Fargo & Sams Club Dear CFPB Director OR Designated Professional : Respectfully, I ask Consumer Financial Protection Bureau for review of the financial information and conditions established for the above-described Personal Loan from Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX NC XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. [ Application ID XXXX at APR 13.494 % - initially it was 13.492 % ] This loan is paid in full, effective XX/XX/XXXX, without any late payments. 

I believe that I have been a victim of a Predatory Personal Loan from Wells Fargo. This Personal Loan consolidated my Wells Fargo credit card debt and Sams Club credit card debt, allegedly to lessen the amount of credit card interest debt that I would otherwise pay out over time. The purpose of my visit to Wells Fargo was to inquire about options that may be available to me for increasing my credit score and lowering my buildup of credit card interest amounts. I had recently learned that my credit score of XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX had decreased to XXXX in XXXX XXXX. Always, in my lifetime, my credit score has been above XXXX, and I wanted to keep it that way. 


On XX/XX/XXXX, I met with XXXX XXXX, Wells Fargo Personal Banker II, Small Business Advocate, with whom I explained my goal to find a way to increase my credit score and to find a way to help lower my credit card interest balance in paying off my Wells Fargo credit card. As a Banking professional, I thought her to have received specialized education and training. I trusted her to be a knowledgeable, trustworthy, skilled, efficient, honest, and sincere Personal Banker who could thoroughly inform and educate me about the matters for which I sought her help. I believed she was acting in my best interests. 

Wells Fargos adsorption of XXXX in XXXX signified that Wells Fargo had a recorded history of ALL my finances since XXXX - income ; taxes ; mortgage ; and meager savings, as well as my food, water, heating, and medical care payments. I informed the Personal Banker that all my financial records were available for her reference and consideration in the WF database. I shared everything about my personal financial situation with her, and I was clear to her that I would need her assistance and patience in helping me to understand all available banking options, procedures, and details, including definitions. I felt ashamed for needing support, and I thought being able to tell someone I trust would help. I give CFPB permission to access all my financial and related information in the databases ( XXXX XXXX Wells Fargo ). 

I explained to her that the monthly payments for the Loan amounted to more than I could afford, and to make the payments, I would need, again, to use my Wells Fargo credit card every month to supplement the cost of my food, medicine, gasoline, and all emergencies that would occur for me over the next 5 years. I thought that all those impending purchases on my WF credit card means that I will eventually end up paying much more interest every month to WF, and I have no savings. I shared all my hand-written notes and calculations with her, knowing that she, being a banking professional, could weigh my income and compare all payments I would be making for the Personal Loan and other expenses via my WF banking records. 

I had misgivings about the rate of interest ( 13.494 % ), the monthly payment amounts, and I was greatly disappointed that my having a mortgage with WF could not positively be considered towards my interest rate. She appeared to consult her manager on this. I know a home with or without a mortgage is still an asset. The Personal Banker told me that I " did not have enough equity '' in my home- which I am financing through WF - therefore, she said, it would not positively affect my credit score towards the loan. In XXXX the property Taxable Amount was {$93000.00} ; now, in XXXX, the Taxable Amount is {$240000.00}. 

Yet, I was tired and felt encouraged to sign the papers. In hindsight, of course, I was stupid for signing! My XXXX XXXXXXXX puts me at risk, stalling my focus and concentration, when I am dealing with a time-consuming and thought-provoking matter. I did not realize the impact my XXXX XXXX had on my ability to manage money or the impact poor money management had on my XXXX XXXX. 


Regardless of those facts, I am aware that I have been victimized- and, perhaps, knowingly. It is my perception that the Professional Personal Banker is liable for negligence in her work, which, in turn, 'set me up to fail ' by contributing to my outrageous and extreme indebtedness for interest paid to Wells Fargo . Today, this very moment, I am indebted more than I was in XX/XX/XXXX, owing Wells Fargo nearly {$25000.00}. 

Over the past 15+ years, I have paid to Wells Fargo an enormous amount of interest. This solitary Personal Loan gained Wells Fargo much more than {$10000.00}, because I was paying interest on top of interest PLUS I needed to use the WF credit card monthly to supplement the needs that I had told the Personal Banker I would not be able to afford with the loan payments -- - more interest! 

Eight months later, after much searching, reading, reviewing, questioning, and studying online banking information, I understood that the Personal Banker II, with whom I had spoken for assistance and guidance, had failed to adequately counsel, inform, advise, support, and work with me in any proper, positive way that might benefit me or my financial status. Upon this realization, I emailed her twice, but she never replied to me. Then, I visited my local branch at WF XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC ) , where I had originally met with her to discuss my finances. I did not see her there, and a gentleman told me she was no longer there. So, I accepted that I was trapped in this loan until the last payment, made on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am XXXX XXXX XXXX, supporting myself on my fixed income, AND I am paying off a WF Personal Loan that was of NO help to me and served no other purpose for me for the past five ( 5 ) years except to exacerbate my indebtedness, my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and my XXXX XXXXXXXX. I now know that the Personal Banker had more reasonable options she could have suggested... a balance transfer credit card or, better yet, simply recommend that - in lieu of monthly {$630.00} loan payments - I should use that money to increase my monthly current payments to my two creditors. I did not need that loan. 

As I stated earlier, for the past five years, I have been reading, inquiring, and educating myself on the US banking structure to prevent me from making future mistakes. The mistake I made in XX/XX/XXXX was : consulting with, listening to, questioning of, and trusting in the Wells Fargo Professional Personal Banker II to perform her job of Personal Banker accurately. 



I have read recently that CFPB classifies credit scores, i.e., " What Makes Someone a Subprime Borrower? '' It caused me to wonder where exactly my XXXX Credit Score would have ranked in XXXX. The lowest scores from XXXX to XXXX are classified as " near-prime, '' I read. Learning that, I wondered why my XXXX Credit Score - actually a PRIME Credit Score - had not benefitted me in obtaining a lower interest rate in XX/XX/XXXX? 

I can not afford an attorney, at this time, to review all information regarding this, my official claim to CFPB of Wells Fargo 's negligence or malpractice. If I had the geographical address of the Personal Banker II, I would share a copy of this information with her. Claims against banking professionals are limited in scope due to wide-reaching business judgment rules. Still, to resolve this issue, I respectfully request : [ 1 ] Wells Fargo 's answers or explanation of the situation that occurred in XX/XX/XXXX, such as " Why, did the Personal Banker choose a Personal Loan for me, in lieu of a better choice, specifically when she knew the interest rate was so high? '' " Why did she violate the duty of care or loyalty? '' Making payments on this loan caused me extreme financial, mental health, and emotional hardship.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I used the website XXXX to reserve a cabin in XXXX, TN for a family vacation at the mountains checking in XX/XX/XXXX, checking out XX/XX/XXXX for the total amount of {$6700.00} that I paid using my Wells Fargo XXXX XXXX XXXX Credit Card. When we showed up at the cabin on XX/XX/XXXX we encountered that the cabin was not in the condition promised, to start with, the property manager called me stating that the cabin wasnt going to be ready at the checking time of XXXX as promised so our family we had to hang out somewhere else until they were done cleaning the cabin. Later that day around XXXX we got to the cabin and noticed that I was given the wrong access code to the cabin and we were locked out the place until I called the property manager and she provided her personal code for us to access. We are in the cabin and noticed how dirty it was, trash was still in the trash cans, the floors were filthy and the water to the whole house smelled like rotten eggs. I communicated all of the issues to the property manager and she did resolve some of them but not all. One of the main issues es the water in the hot tub, there was oil floating on top, white flakes floating in the water and even some toenails, I made the property manager aware and she sent someone the next day to overflow the hot tub in order for the oil to spill out, not change the water, only overflow it which did not resolve the issue. Many other complaints were made to the property manager I cant list or explain all of them but I have photos, videos and messages from the property manager to prove all and each of them. A couple of days before we were to check out my sister ( one of the guests at the cabin ) started having a bad headache, we run to the store and got XXXX thinking it was something simple, the next day she got worse and started running a fever, we still didnt think any of it and the next day we were checking out so she planned on going to the doctor when home. The day we checked out since we drove separate vehicles my sister and her family went a different way, we were getting close to home when her husband calls me to tell me that he is taking her to the emergency room because her fever is really high, she is shaking and XXXX is no longer working. I remember talking to her the day before and we were trying to figure out what was going on. She told me that she got in the hot tub and when she was going in, she noticed the tub was slimy and she slipped and fall, she didnt worry about it because she didnt hit herself but she ended up going underwater for a few seconds, she got out and didnt go back in. She made it to the hospital and was told that she had a bad XXXX XXXX because she had XXXX in her ears caused by dirty water, the water in the hot tub, she was at the hospital two days where she was given XXXX for the pain because it was so bad. I immediately contacted XXXX to let them know what was going on and asked for a partial refund so to all the struggles we went through at the cabin and more than anything to compensate for what my sister was going through. I told them I wanted to help her pay the hospital bill since I felt guilty for what had happened to her. It was quite a fight and after back and forward emails with XXXX, unanswered messages to the host/owner XXXX XXXXs and property manager XXXX, XXXX ended up refunding me the service fee of {$770.00}, they were not able to refund the rest because the host/owner used a third party managing company ( XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) to charge for the rest of the balance which was {$5900.00} so I had to deal with them directly which doesnt not make sense since I used the XXXX platform for the reservation and thought they were the ones handling everything but anyway I dealt with the host as well, I sent several messages through XXXX website because I didnt have a direct number, I didnt have a number for the property managing company, the only thing I have is the phone number to the property manager XXXX but according to her she doesnt deal with refunds, the host/owner XXXX XXXX handles that but he doesnt answer messages and there is not a phone number where I can reach him directly. I also filed a claim through my bank since I could not get a hold of the host/owner but days after Wells Fargo closed the dispute alleging that they provided the service they promised a cabin, I guess the filthy status of the cabin did not matter, it didnt matter that someone ended up at the hospital due to this. I called the bank and argued that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX didnt provide the service they promised, because they promised a clean cabin, a timely check in time, clean premises with all essentials included and they did not kept the promise sending someone to the hospital. Wells Fargo had proof of everything, photos, videos, messages, descriptions, etc. I argued that in one of the message conversations with property manager XXXX, she even admits that the cabin is not in good condition to be rented and I believe this conversation was not taken into consideration, I believe Wells Fargo back just jumped into the conclusion that a cabin was provided and that was it, they close the case with an unfavorable decision against me. At this time after all the wasted time with the bank I kept fighting with XXXX and this time I didnt want a partial refund, I wanted ALL my money back {$5900.00} we fought for a while and finally on XX/XX/year> I received a message from the host on XXXX website that reads the following Weve processed your refund. It may take up to 15 days for this refund to reflect in your original for of payment. Please contact your bank for further updates. I felt relief and waited for the money to post to my Wells Fargo Credit Card account. The date today is XX/XX/year> and the money is still not in my account. XXXX suggested to initiate a chargeback process with my bank Wells Fargo but they argued that this cant be done because the dispute is being closed. I also messaged the host to find out whats going on and got no answer. According to XXXX, they contacted him as well and they did get a response from him, this is what the email from XXXX reads I am contacting you as agreed in the previous email to inform you that the last request sent to the property manager to confirm the refund has been answered and they, as those responsible for the property, have denied that they will process any refund of the rental payment. After promising a refund back in XX/XX/XXXX, they backed up and now they dont want to refund the money. I am really disappointed, specially with my bank Wells Fargo, I have been banking with them for more than 20 years and they cant even fight this for me. The bank, the host/owner, the property manager and XXXX  are getting away with this, really?? Where are we as customers left in a situation like this? I know that my sisters hospital bill will be higher that the full refund I am requesting, I feel guilty and obligated to help her with the expenses and this refund will definitely help us. Wells Fargo Bank has evidence of all issues with the cabin, including photos, videos, screenshots of conversations with property manager XXXX and with host/owner XXXX XXXX XXXX photos of my sister at the hospital showing dates, they had all the evidence that proved that XXXX violated their Book With Confidence Guarantee mentioned in their website. I want to believe that you will make the right decision in this matter and protect a customer that at this time feels like no one cares about.

Consumer complaint narrative:
on XX/XX/2024 i received a letter in the mail from Innovis saying it had obtained without my written permission my private non public information including my government issued social security card. when i was made aware of this i immediately called and i spoke with a supervisor named XXXX, i demanded that my non public private information be removed immediately and deleted from the Innovis data base. XXXX told me NO she will not remove my social security number or opt me out from Innovis database she said no multiple times, XXXX said she received my information from a creditor, yet refused to send provide me documentation or identify the supposed creditor. I told her i did not give Innovis permission or written instruction to use my social security number and i instructed her to removed all my non public information from the data base she continued to refused. This is identity theft and fraud. Innovis is knowingly violating my rights and committing identity Theft and fraud under Federal law according to 18 U.S.C. 1028.

Identity theft offenses occur when someone uses another 's personal information for economic gain or to take the identity of someone else. These federal offenses usually involve fraud, deception, false statements, or misrepresentations. In other words, someone steals another 's person 's identifying information, uses stolen identities, or copies information without consent.

Did I give you written or any consent?

Identity theft laws under 18 U.S.C. 1028 makes it a crime to misuse someone's identifying information, whether personal or financial. Personal identifying information can include social security numbers, driver 's license number, credit card or bank account information, and PIN numbers obtained through the internet.

Did i give you my social security number?

Innovis is Producing without lawful authority an identification document or a false identification document ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 1 ) ) ; Innovis is Transferring an identification document or a false identification document knowing that such document was stolen or produced without lawful authority ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 2 ) ) ; Innovis is Possessing with intent to use unlawfully five or more identification documents ( other than those issued lawfully for the use of the possessor ) or false identification documents ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 3 ) ) ; Innovis is Possessing with intent to transfer unlawfully five or more identification documents ( other than those issued lawfully for the use of the possessor ) or false identification documents ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 3 ) ) ; Innovis is Possessing an identification document ( other than one issued lawfully for the use of the possessor ) or a false identification document with the intent such document be used to defraud the United States ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 4 ) ) ; Innovis is Possessing an identification document that is an identification document of the United States which is stolen, knowing that such document was stolen ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 6 ) ) ; Innovis is Possessing an identification document that appears to be an identification document of the United States, which was produced without authority knowing that such document was produced without authority ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 6 ) ) ; Innovis is Producing, transferring, or possessing a document-making implement with the intent that such document-making implement be used in the production of a false identification document ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 5 ) ) ; Innovis is Producing, transferring, or possessing a document-making implement with the intent that such document-making implement be used in the production of another document-making implement which will be used in the production of a false identification document ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ( 5 ) ) ; and Attempting to do any of the above ( 18 U.S.C. 1028 ( a ) ).

I demand Innovis delete all my information from their database.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have not been provided monetary and other credits promised by American Express for using AMEX credit card No. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I applied for and received an American Express Delta Platinum XXXX XXXX. The initiation fee for the credit card was {$250.00} and under the advertised terms of the card, American Express would credit the card holder ( me ) {$400.00} after the card had been used to purchase a Delta XXXX flight. Additionally, American Express agreed to credit the card holder with XXXX Delta miles after {$3000.00} had been charged to the card within the first XXXX months. I achieved both of these milestones within the allocated time. 

Beginning in XX/XX/2022, I called American Express to find out why I had received neither the {$400.00} credit nor the XXXX miles. I was told both were " in process '' and that I would receive them shortly. After three further calls over the following several weeks I was finally told that American Express had decided to not credit the {$400.00} or the XXXX miles because I had had other American Express cards in the past which I had cancelled. ( I don't keep a record of my credit cards but I estimate I have had 3-4 American Express cards over the past 30 years ). I explained to the American Express agent that if American Express did not wish to honor these credits it should not have accepted my application in the first place. Furthermore, by accepting my application and charging me, and receiving, the {$250.00} initiation fee there was a de facto offer and acceptance of the advertised terms. 

After several attempts politely asking American Express to honor its commitment, I canceled the credit card and explained to an agent at American Express that I was leaving a balance on the card of {$250.00} as an offset against the initiation fee which I had paid when I received the card. 

For the last 18 months or so, American Express has hounded me with robo calls and has turned my account over to two collection agencies. ( I have spoken to both and after they heard the details of the alleged indebtedness neither agency bothered me again ). American Express has continued to add interest charges and late fees which now total over {$840.00} and has damaged my otherwise excellent credit rating. 

Since American Express has repeatedly refused to recredit the initiation fee for the credit card, I am now seeking to collect the {$400.00} credit that American Express owes me for purchasing the Delta XXXX ticket plus {$900.00}, which is a conservative estimate of the value of the XXXX Delta miles owed to me less the {$250.00} balance I left on the credit card when I canceled the card. This totals {$1000.00}.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Advertising and marketing, including promotional offers
Sub-issue: Didn't receive advertised or promotional terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally register a complaint against Chase Bank for their recent conduct, which has resulted in both financial losses and considerable inconvenience on my part. This issue involves a promotional offer involving the Amazon Prime Card, which Chase advertised during XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Chase 's advertisement promised customers a 7 % cashback on all purchases made using the XXXX XXXX XXXX during the event. This promotion was the sole reason I decided to obtain the XXXX XXXX XXXX, despite already being a holder of two other Chase cards. The attractive cashback offer seemed like an advantageous deal and thus, I found it compelling enough to add another card to my account. 

Encouraged by this promotion, I placed orders worth {$3000.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, and further orders amounting to several thousand dollars on XX/XX/XXXX. To my dismay, Chase began to decline my purchases after a certain point, despite my immediate attempts to resolve the situation. I personally contacted Chase multiple times, conversing with different representatives from their fraud protection department and customer service, yet my transactions continued to be denied. Over 20 attempted purchases were declined, causing my orders to be delayed until after XX/XX/2023. 

This unexplained and ongoing denial of transactions deprived me of the cashback benefits that Chase had promised, resulting in my orders being pushed beyond the promotional period. Additionally, the " no rush delivery '' option on XXXX, which was advertised to offer extra cashback, was negated due to these transaction denials, resulting in further loss of hundreds of dollars. 

I believe this constitutes false advertising and a breach of trust on Chase 's part. Their failure to honor the promotional terms they used to entice customers into obtaining the new card, combined with their inability to address the issue adequately, have caused me significant financial losses and distress. 

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter, hold Chase accountable for their actions, and ensure suitable redress is provided to affected customers, including myself. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will handle this complaint seriously, and I look forward to your prompt response.
Company public response: None

I am writing to formally submit a complaint regarding the discriminatory experiences I encountered while attempting to apply for a credit card at Wells Fargo Bank, specifically at the branch located in XXXX, North Carolina. My complaint pertains to the bank 's inconsistent treatment of credit card applicants based on their immigration and residency status, which is in direct violation of U.S. regulations and the principles of equality and non-discrimination.

During my attempts to secure a credit card from Wells Fargo Bank, my applications were repeatedly declined, with bank representatives insisting that I needed to provide proof of XXXX citizenship or XXXX residency. It is important to note that this requirement was never communicated in any pre-application documentation or during the application process, and there is no public disclosure of such a requirement as a condition for credit card approval by Wells Fargo. 

Of great concern is the fact that two acquaintances with immigration and residency statuses similar to mine were able to obtain credit cards from the same Wells Fargo branch without any issues. This discrepancy in treatment has led me to believe that there is an inconsistency in the bank 's application evaluation process. 

In an effort to address this issue, I visited the branch and filed a complaint for resolution within the Wells Fargo system. However, to my disappointment, no one from the bank has reached out to me to address my concerns, nor have I received a clear and satisfactory response regarding the specific requirements, if any, for XXXX citizenship or residency for credit card approval. 

I hold a valid Social Security card and am currently legally employed in the United States. Additionally, I possess credit cards issued by other financial institutions, which suggests that I meet the necessary criteria for credit card eligibility, provided that consistent standards are applied to all applicants.
